2254 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

2255      """Build hooks env. 
2256   
2257      This will run on all nodes before, and on all nodes + the new node after. 
2258   
2259      """ 
2260      env = { 
2261        "OP_TARGET": self.op.node_name, 
2262        "NODE_NAME": self.op.node_name, 
2263        "NODE_PIP": self.op.primary_ip, 
2264        "NODE_SIP": self.op.secondary_ip, 
2265        } 
2266      nodes_0 = self.cfg.GetNodeList() 
2267      nodes_1 = nodes_0 + [self.op.node_name, ] 
2268      return env, nodes_0, nodes_1 

2269   

2270 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

2271      """Check prerequisites. 
2272   
2273      This checks: 
2274       - the new node is not already in the config 
2275       - it is resolvable 
2276       - its parameters (single/dual homed) matches the cluster 
2277   
2278      Any errors are signaled by raising errors.OpPrereqError. 
2279   
2280      """ 
2281      node_name = self.op.node_name 
2282      cfg = self.cfg 
2283   
2284      dns_data = utils.HostInfo(node_name) 
2285   
2286      node = dns_data.name 
2287      primary_ip = self.op.primary_ip = dns_data.ip 
2288      secondary_ip = getattr(self.op, "secondary_ip", None) 
2289      if secondary_ip is None: 
2290        secondary_ip = primary_ip 
2291      if not utils.IsValidIP(secondary_ip): 
2292        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid secondary IP given") 
2293      self.op.secondary_ip = secondary_ip 
2294   
2295      node_list = cfg.GetNodeList() 
2296      if not self.op.readd and node in node_list: 
2297        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node %s is already in the configuration" % 
2298                                   node) 
2299      elif self.op.readd and node not in node_list: 
2300        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node %s is not in the configuration" % node) 
2301   
2302      for existing_node_name in node_list: 
2303        existing_node = cfg.GetNodeInfo(existing_node_name) 
2304   
2305        if self.op.readd and node == existing_node_name: 
2306          if (existing_node.primary_ip != primary_ip or 
2307              existing_node.secondary_ip != secondary_ip): 
2308            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Readded node doesn't have the same IP" 
2309                                       " address configuration as before") 
2310          continue 
2311   
2312        if (existing_node.primary_ip == primary_ip or 
2313            existing_node.secondary_ip == primary_ip or 
2314            existing_node.primary_ip == secondary_ip or 
2315            existing_node.secondary_ip == secondary_ip): 
2316          raise errors.OpPrereqError("New node ip address(es) conflict with" 
2317                                     " existing node %s" % existing_node.name) 
2318   
2319      # check that the type of the node (single versus dual homed) is the 
2320      # same as for the master 
2321      myself = cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.cfg.GetMasterNode()) 
2322      master_singlehomed = myself.secondary_ip == myself.primary_ip 
2323      newbie_singlehomed = secondary_ip == primary_ip 
2324      if master_singlehomed != newbie_singlehomed: 
2325        if master_singlehomed: 
2326          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The master has no private ip but the" 
2327                                     " new node has one") 
2328        else: 
2329          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The master has a private ip but the" 
2330                                     " new node doesn't have one") 
2331   
2332      # checks reachability 
2333      if not utils.TcpPing(primary_ip, constants.DEFAULT_NODED_PORT): 
2334        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node not reachable by ping") 
2335   
2336      if not newbie_singlehomed: 
2337        # check reachability from my secondary ip to newbie's secondary ip 
2338        if not utils.TcpPing(secondary_ip, constants.DEFAULT_NODED_PORT, 
2339                             source=myself.secondary_ip): 
2340          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node secondary ip not reachable by TCP" 
2341                                     " based ping to noded port") 
2342   
2343      cp_size = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().candidate_pool_size 
2344      if self.op.readd: 
2345        exceptions = [node] 
2346      else: 
2347        exceptions = [] 
2348      mc_now, mc_max = self.cfg.GetMasterCandidateStats(exceptions) 
2349      # the new node will increase mc_max with one, so: 
2350      mc_max = min(mc_max + 1, cp_size) 
2351      self.master_candidate = mc_now < mc_max 
2352   
2353      if self.op.readd: 
2354        self.new_node = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(node) 
2355        assert self.new_node is not None, "Can't retrieve locked node %s" % node 
2356      else: 
2357        self.new_node = objects.Node(name=node, 
2358                                     primary_ip=primary_ip, 
2359                                     secondary_ip=secondary_ip, 
2360                                     master_candidate=self.master_candidate, 
2361                                     offline=False, drained=False) 

2362   

2363 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

2364      """Adds the new node to the cluster. 
2365   
2366      """ 
2367      new_node = self.new_node 
2368      node = new_node.name 
2369   
2370      # for re-adds, reset the offline/drained/master-candidate flags; 
2371      # we need to reset here, otherwise offline would prevent RPC calls 
2372      # later in the procedure; this also means that if the re-add 
2373      # fails, we are left with a non-offlined, broken node 
2374      if self.op.readd: 
2375        new_node.drained = new_node.offline = False 
2376        self.LogInfo("Readding a node, the offline/drained flags were reset") 
2377        # if we demote the node, we do cleanup later in the procedure 
2378        new_node.master_candidate = self.master_candidate 
2379   
2380      # notify the user about any possible mc promotion 
2381      if new_node.master_candidate: 
2382        self.LogInfo("Node will be a master candidate") 
2383   
2384      # check connectivity 
2385      result = self.rpc.call_version([node])[node] 
2386      result.Raise() 
2387      if result.data: 
2388        if constants.PROTOCOL_VERSION == result.data: 
2389          logging.info("Communication to node %s fine, sw version %s match", 
2390                       node, result.data) 
2391        else: 
2392          raise errors.OpExecError("Version mismatch master version %s," 
2393                                   " node version %s" % 
2394                                   (constants.PROTOCOL_VERSION, result.data)) 
2395      else: 
2396        raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot get version from the new node") 
2397   
2398      # setup ssh on node 
2399      logging.info("Copy ssh key to node %s", node) 
2400      priv_key, pub_key, _ = ssh.GetUserFiles(constants.GANETI_RUNAS) 
2401      keyarray = [] 
2402      keyfiles = [constants.SSH_HOST_DSA_PRIV, constants.SSH_HOST_DSA_PUB, 
2403                  constants.SSH_HOST_RSA_PRIV, constants.SSH_HOST_RSA_PUB, 
2404                  priv_key, pub_key] 
2405   
2406      for i in keyfiles: 
2407        f = open(i, 'r') 
2408        try: 
2409          keyarray.append(f.read()) 
2410        finally: 
2411          f.close() 
2412   
2413      result = self.rpc.call_node_add(node, keyarray[0], keyarray[1], 
2414                                      keyarray[2], 
2415                                      keyarray[3], keyarray[4], keyarray[5]) 
2416   
2417      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
2418      if msg: 
2419        raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot transfer ssh keys to the" 
2420                                 " new node: %s" % msg) 
2421   
2422      # Add node to our /etc/hosts, and add key to known_hosts 
2423      if self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().modify_etc_hosts: 
2424        utils.AddHostToEtcHosts(new_node.name) 
2425   
2426      if new_node.secondary_ip != new_node.primary_ip: 
2427        result = self.rpc.call_node_has_ip_address(new_node.name, 
2428                                                   new_node.secondary_ip) 
2429        if result.failed or not result.data: 
2430          raise errors.OpExecError("Node claims it doesn't have the secondary ip" 
2431                                   " you gave (%s). Please fix and re-run this" 
2432                                   " command." % new_node.secondary_ip) 
2433   
2434      node_verify_list = [self.cfg.GetMasterNode()] 
2435      node_verify_param = { 
2436        'nodelist': [node], 
2437        # TODO: do a node-net-test as well? 
2438      } 
2439   
2440      result = self.rpc.call_node_verify(node_verify_list, node_verify_param, 
2441                                         self.cfg.GetClusterName()) 
2442      for verifier in node_verify_list: 
2443        if result[verifier].failed or not result[verifier].data: 
2444          raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot communicate with %s's node daemon" 
2445                                   " for remote verification" % verifier) 
2446        if result[verifier].data['nodelist']: 
2447          for failed in result[verifier].data['nodelist']: 
2448            feedback_fn("ssh/hostname verification failed" 
2449                        " (checking from %s): %s" % 
2450                        (verifier, result[verifier].data['nodelist'][failed])) 
2451          raise errors.OpExecError("ssh/hostname verification failed.") 
2452   
2453      # Distribute updated /etc/hosts and known_hosts to all nodes, 
2454      # including the node just added 
2455      myself = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.cfg.GetMasterNode()) 
2456      dist_nodes = self.cfg.GetNodeList() 
2457      if not self.op.readd: 
2458        dist_nodes.append(node) 
2459      if myself.name in dist_nodes: 
2460        dist_nodes.remove(myself.name) 
2461   
2462      logging.debug("Copying hosts and known_hosts to all nodes") 
2463      for fname in (constants.ETC_HOSTS, constants.SSH_KNOWN_HOSTS_FILE): 
2464        result = self.rpc.call_upload_file(dist_nodes, fname) 
2465        for to_node, to_result in result.iteritems(): 
2466          if to_result.failed or not to_result.data: 
2467            logging.error("Copy of file %s to node %s failed", fname, to_node) 
2468   
2469      to_copy = [] 
2470      enabled_hypervisors = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().enabled_hypervisors 
2471      if constants.HTS_COPY_VNC_PASSWORD.intersection(enabled_hypervisors): 
2472        to_copy.append(constants.VNC_PASSWORD_FILE) 
2473   
2474      for fname in to_copy: 
2475        result = self.rpc.call_upload_file([node], fname) 
2476        if result[node].failed or not result[node]: 
2477          logging.error("Could not copy file %s to node %s", fname, node) 
2478   
2479      if self.op.readd: 
2480        self.context.ReaddNode(new_node) 
2481        # make sure we redistribute the config 
2482        self.cfg.Update(new_node) 
2483        # and make sure the new node will not have old files around 
2484        if not new_node.master_candidate: 
2485          result = self.rpc.call_node_demote_from_mc(new_node.name) 
2486          msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
2487          if msg: 
2488            self.LogWarning("Node failed to demote itself from master" 
2489                            " candidate status: %s" % msg) 
2490      else: 
2491        self.context.AddNode(new_node) 

2492

2537 -  def CheckPrereq(self):

2539   
2540      This only checks the instance list against the existing names.

2544   
2545      if (self.op.master_candidate is not None or 
2546          self.op.drained is not None or 
2547          self.op.offline is not None): 
2548        # we can't change the master's node flags 
2549        if self.op.node_name == self.cfg.GetMasterNode(): 
2550          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The master role can be changed" 
2551                                     " only via masterfailover") 
2552   
2553      if ((self.op.master_candidate == False or self.op.offline == True or 
2554           self.op.drained == True) and node.master_candidate): 
2555        cp_size = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().candidate_pool_size 
2556        num_candidates, _ = self.cfg.GetMasterCandidateStats() 
2557        if num_candidates <= cp_size: 
2558          msg = ("Not enough master candidates (desired" 
2559                 " %d, new value will be %d)" % (cp_size, num_candidates-1)) 
2560          if self.op.force: 
2561            self.LogWarning(msg) 
2562          else: 
2563            raise errors.OpPrereqError(msg) 
2564   
2565      if (self.op.master_candidate == True and 
2566          ((node.offline and not self.op.offline == False) or 
2567           (node.drained and not self.op.drained == False))): 
2568        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node '%s' is offline or drained, can't set" 
2569                                   " to master_candidate" % node.name) 
2570   
2571      return

2573 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

2574      """Modifies a node. 
2575   
2576      """ 
2577      node = self.node 
2578   
2579      result = [] 
2580      changed_mc = False 
2581   
2582      if self.op.offline is not None: 
2583        node.offline = self.op.offline 
2584        result.append(("offline", str(self.op.offline))) 
2585        if self.op.offline == True: 
2586          if node.master_candidate: 
2587            node.master_candidate = False 
2588            changed_mc = True 
2589            result.append(("master_candidate", "auto-demotion due to offline")) 
2590          if node.drained: 
2591            node.drained = False 
2592            result.append(("drained", "clear drained status due to offline")) 
2593   
2594      if self.op.master_candidate is not None: 
2595        node.master_candidate = self.op.master_candidate 
2596        changed_mc = True 
2597        result.append(("master_candidate", str(self.op.master_candidate))) 
2598        if self.op.master_candidate == False: 
2599          rrc = self.rpc.call_node_demote_from_mc(node.name) 
2600          msg = rrc.RemoteFailMsg() 
2601          if msg: 
2602            self.LogWarning("Node failed to demote itself: %s" % msg) 
2603   
2604      if self.op.drained is not None: 
2605        node.drained = self.op.drained 
2606        result.append(("drained", str(self.op.drained))) 
2607        if self.op.drained == True: 
2608          if node.master_candidate: 
2609            node.master_candidate = False 
2610            changed_mc = True 
2611            result.append(("master_candidate", "auto-demotion due to drain")) 
2612            rrc = self.rpc.call_node_demote_from_mc(node.name) 
2613            msg = rrc.RemoteFailMsg() 
2614            if msg: 
2615              self.LogWarning("Node failed to demote itself: %s" % msg) 
2616          if node.offline: 
2617            node.offline = False 
2618            result.append(("offline", "clear offline status due to drain")) 
2619   
2620      # this will trigger configuration file update, if needed 
2621      self.cfg.Update(node) 
2622      # this will trigger job queue propagation or cleanup 
2623      if changed_mc: 
2624        self.context.ReaddNode(node) 
2625   
2626      return result

2756   
2757 -def _AssembleInstanceDisks(lu, instance, ignore_secondaries=False, 
2758                             ignore_size=False): 

2759    """Prepare the block devices for an instance. 
2760   
2761    This sets up the block devices on all nodes. 
2762   
2763    @type lu: L{LogicalUnit} 
2764    @param lu: the logical unit on whose behalf we execute 
2765    @type instance: L{objects.Instance} 
2766    @param instance: the instance for whose disks we assemble 
2767    @type ignore_secondaries: boolean 
2768    @param ignore_secondaries: if true, errors on secondary nodes 
2769        won't result in an error return from the function 
2770    @type ignore_size: boolean 
2771    @param ignore_size: if true, the current known size of the disk 
2772        will not be used during the disk activation, useful for cases 
2773        when the size is wrong 
2774    @return: False if the operation failed, otherwise a list of 
2775        (host, instance_visible_name, node_visible_name) 
2776        with the mapping from node devices to instance devices 
2777   
2778    """ 
2779    device_info = [] 
2780    disks_ok = True 
2781    iname = instance.name 
2782    # With the two passes mechanism we try to reduce the window of 
2783    # opportunity for the race condition of switching DRBD to primary 
2784    # before handshaking occured, but we do not eliminate it 
2785   
2786    # The proper fix would be to wait (with some limits) until the 
2787    # connection has been made and drbd transitions from WFConnection 
2788    # into any other network-connected state (Connected, SyncTarget, 
2789    # SyncSource, etc.) 
2790   
2791    # 1st pass, assemble on all nodes in secondary mode 
2792    for inst_disk in instance.disks: 
2793      for node, node_disk in inst_disk.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
2794        if ignore_size: 
2795          node_disk = node_disk.Copy() 
2796          node_disk.UnsetSize() 
2797        lu.cfg.SetDiskID(node_disk, node) 
2798        result = lu.rpc.call_blockdev_assemble(node, node_disk, iname, False) 
2799        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
2800        if msg: 
2801          lu.proc.LogWarning("Could not prepare block device %s on node %s" 
2802                             " (is_primary=False, pass=1): %s", 
2803                             inst_disk.iv_name, node, msg) 
2804          if not ignore_secondaries: 
2805            disks_ok = False 
2806   
2807    # FIXME: race condition on drbd migration to primary 
2808   
2809    # 2nd pass, do only the primary node 
2810    for inst_disk in instance.disks: 
2811      for node, node_disk in inst_disk.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
2812        if node != instance.primary_node: 
2813          continue 
2814        if ignore_size: 
2815          node_disk = node_disk.Copy() 
2816          node_disk.UnsetSize() 
2817        lu.cfg.SetDiskID(node_disk, node) 
2818        result = lu.rpc.call_blockdev_assemble(node, node_disk, iname, True) 
2819        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
2820        if msg: 
2821          lu.proc.LogWarning("Could not prepare block device %s on node %s" 
2822                             " (is_primary=True, pass=2): %s", 
2823                             inst_disk.iv_name, node, msg) 
2824          disks_ok = False 
2825      device_info.append((instance.primary_node, inst_disk.iv_name, 
2826                          result.payload)) 
2827   
2828    # leave the disks configured for the primary node 
2829    # this is a workaround that would be fixed better by 
2830    # improving the logical/physical id handling 
2831    for disk in instance.disks: 
2832      lu.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, instance.primary_node) 
2833   
2834    return disks_ok, device_info 

2835   

2836   
2837 -def _StartInstanceDisks(lu, instance, force): 

2838    """Start the disks of an instance. 
2839   
2840    """ 
2841    disks_ok, _ = _AssembleInstanceDisks(lu, instance, 
2842                                             ignore_secondaries=force) 
2843    if not disks_ok: 
2844      _ShutdownInstanceDisks(lu, instance) 
2845      if force is not None and not force: 
2846        lu.proc.LogWarning("", hint="If the message above refers to a" 
2847                           " secondary node," 
2848                           " you can retry the operation using '--force'.") 
2849      raise errors.OpExecError("Disk consistency error") 

2850   

2851

2886 -def _SafeShutdownInstanceDisks(lu, instance): 

2887    """Shutdown block devices of an instance. 
2888   
2889    This function checks if an instance is running, before calling 
2890    _ShutdownInstanceDisks. 
2891   
2892    """ 
2893    ins_l = lu.rpc.call_instance_list([instance.primary_node], 
2894                                        [instance.hypervisor]) 
2895    ins_l = ins_l[instance.primary_node] 
2896    if ins_l.failed or not isinstance(ins_l.data, list): 
2897      raise errors.OpExecError("Can't contact node '%s'" % 
2898                               instance.primary_node) 
2899   
2900    if instance.name in ins_l.data: 
2901      raise errors.OpExecError("Instance is running, can't shutdown" 
2902                               " block devices.") 
2903   
2904    _ShutdownInstanceDisks(lu, instance) 

2905   

2906   
2907 -def _ShutdownInstanceDisks(lu, instance, ignore_primary=False): 

2908    """Shutdown block devices of an instance. 
2909   
2910    This does the shutdown on all nodes of the instance. 
2911   
2912    If the ignore_primary is false, errors on the primary node are 
2913    ignored. 
2914   
2915    """ 
2916    all_result = True 
2917    for disk in instance.disks: 
2918      for node, top_disk in disk.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
2919        lu.cfg.SetDiskID(top_disk, node) 
2920        result = lu.rpc.call_blockdev_shutdown(node, top_disk) 
2921        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
2922        if msg: 
2923          lu.LogWarning("Could not shutdown block device %s on node %s: %s", 
2924                        disk.iv_name, node, msg) 
2925          if not ignore_primary or node != instance.primary_node: 
2926            all_result = False 
2927    return all_result 

2928   

2929   
2930 -def _CheckNodeFreeMemory(lu, node, reason, requested, hypervisor_name): 

2931    """Checks if a node has enough free memory. 
2932   
2933    This function check if a given node has the needed amount of free 
2934    memory. In case the node has less memory or we cannot get the 
2935    information from the node, this function raise an OpPrereqError 
2936    exception. 
2937   
2938    @type lu: C{LogicalUnit} 
2939    @param lu: a logical unit from which we get configuration data 
2940    @type node: C{str} 
2941    @param node: the node to check 
2942    @type reason: C{str} 
2943    @param reason: string to use in the error message 
2944    @type requested: C{int} 
2945    @param requested: the amount of memory in MiB to check for 
2946    @type hypervisor_name: C{str} 
2947    @param hypervisor_name: the hypervisor to ask for memory stats 
2948    @raise errors.OpPrereqError: if the node doesn't have enough memory, or 
2949        we cannot check the node 
2950   
2951    """ 
2952    nodeinfo = lu.rpc.call_node_info([node], lu.cfg.GetVGName(), hypervisor_name) 
2953    nodeinfo[node].Raise() 
2954    free_mem = nodeinfo[node].data.get('memory_free') 
2955    if not isinstance(free_mem, int): 
2956      raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute free memory on node %s, result" 
2957                               " was '%s'" % (node, free_mem)) 
2958    if requested > free_mem: 
2959      raise errors.OpPrereqError("Not enough memory on node %s for %s:" 
2960                               " needed %s MiB, available %s MiB" % 
2961                               (node, reason, requested, free_mem)) 

2962

3225      assert instance is not None, \ 
3226        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
3227      _CheckNodeOnline(self, instance.primary_node) 
3228   
3229      if instance.disk_template == constants.DT_DISKLESS: 
3230        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' has no disks" % 
3231                                   self.op.instance_name) 
3232      if instance.admin_up: 
3233        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' is marked to be up" % 
3234                                   self.op.instance_name) 
3235      remote_info = self.rpc.call_instance_info(instance.primary_node, 
3236                                                instance.name, 
3237                                                instance.hypervisor) 
3238      remote_info.Raise() 
3239      if remote_info.data: 
3240        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' is running on the node %s" % 
3241                                   (self.op.instance_name, 
3242                                    instance.primary_node)) 
3243

3245      if self.op.os_type is not None: 
3246        # OS verification 
3247        pnode = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo( 
3248          self.cfg.ExpandNodeName(instance.primary_node)) 
3249        if pnode is None: 
3250          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Primary node '%s' is unknown" % 
3251                                     self.op.pnode) 
3252        result = self.rpc.call_os_get(pnode.name, self.op.os_type) 
3253        result.Raise() 
3254        if not isinstance(result.data, objects.OS): 
3255          raise errors.OpPrereqError("OS '%s' not in supported OS list for" 
3256                                     " primary node"  % self.op.os_type) 
3257

3265

3267        feedback_fn("Changing OS to '%s'..." % self.op.os_type) 
3268        inst.os = self.op.os_type 
3269        self.cfg.Update(inst) 
3270

3344 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

3345      """Reinstall the instance. 
3346   
3347      """ 
3348      inst = self.instance 
3349      old_name = inst.name 
3350   
3351      if inst.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
3352        old_file_storage_dir = os.path.dirname(inst.disks[0].logical_id[1]) 
3353   
3354      self.cfg.RenameInstance(inst.name, self.op.new_name) 
3355      # Change the instance lock. This is definitely safe while we hold the BGL 
3356      self.context.glm.remove(locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE, old_name) 
3357      self.context.glm.add(locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE, self.op.new_name) 
3358   
3359      # re-read the instance from the configuration after rename 
3360      inst = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.op.new_name) 
3361   
3362      if inst.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
3363        new_file_storage_dir = os.path.dirname(inst.disks[0].logical_id[1]) 
3364        result = self.rpc.call_file_storage_dir_rename(inst.primary_node, 
3365                                                       old_file_storage_dir, 
3366                                                       new_file_storage_dir) 
3367        result.Raise() 
3368        if not result.data: 
3369          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not connect to node '%s' to rename" 
3370                                   " directory '%s' to '%s' (but the instance" 
3371                                   " has been renamed in Ganeti)" % ( 
3372                                   inst.primary_node, old_file_storage_dir, 
3373                                   new_file_storage_dir)) 
3374   
3375        if not result.data[0]: 
3376          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not rename directory '%s' to '%s'" 
3377                                   " (but the instance has been renamed in" 
3378                                   " Ganeti)" % (old_file_storage_dir, 
3379                                                 new_file_storage_dir)) 
3380   
3381      _StartInstanceDisks(self, inst, None) 
3382      try: 
3383        result = self.rpc.call_instance_run_rename(inst.primary_node, inst, 
3384                                                   old_name) 
3385        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
3386        if msg: 
3387          msg = ("Could not run OS rename script for instance %s on node %s" 
3388                 " (but the instance has been renamed in Ganeti): %s" % 
3389                 (inst.name, inst.primary_node, msg)) 
3390          self.proc.LogWarning(msg) 
3391      finally: 
3392        _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, inst)

3464   
3465 -class LUQueryInstances(NoHooksLU): 

3466    """Logical unit for querying instances. 
3467   
3468    """ 
3469    _OP_REQP = ["output_fields", "names", "use_locking"] 
3470    REQ_BGL = False 
3471    _FIELDS_STATIC = utils.FieldSet(*["name", "os", "pnode", "snodes", 
3472                                      "admin_state", 
3473                                      "disk_template", "ip", "mac", "bridge", 
3474                                      "sda_size", "sdb_size", "vcpus", "tags", 
3475                                      "network_port", "beparams", 
3476                                      r"(disk)\.(size)/([0-9]+)", 
3477                                      r"(disk)\.(sizes)", "disk_usage", 
3478                                      r"(nic)\.(mac|ip|bridge)/([0-9]+)", 
3479                                      r"(nic)\.(macs|ips|bridges)", 
3480                                      r"(disk|nic)\.(count)", 
3481                                      "serial_no", "hypervisor", "hvparams",] + 
3482                                    ["hv/%s" % name 
3483                                     for name in constants.HVS_PARAMETERS] + 
3484                                    ["be/%s" % name 
3485                                     for name in constants.BES_PARAMETERS]) 
3486    _FIELDS_DYNAMIC = utils.FieldSet("oper_state", "oper_ram", "status") 
3487   
3488   

3489 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

3490      _CheckOutputFields(static=self._FIELDS_STATIC, 
3491                         dynamic=self._FIELDS_DYNAMIC, 
3492                         selected=self.op.output_fields) 
3493   
3494      self.needed_locks = {} 
3495      self.share_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = 1 
3496      self.share_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = 1 
3497   
3498      if self.op.names: 
3499        self.wanted = _GetWantedInstances(self, self.op.names) 
3500      else: 
3501        self.wanted = locking.ALL_SET 
3502   
3503      self.do_node_query = self._FIELDS_STATIC.NonMatching(self.op.output_fields) 
3504      self.do_locking = self.do_node_query and self.op.use_locking 
3505      if self.do_locking: 
3506        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = self.wanted 
3507        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = [] 
3508        self.recalculate_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = constants.LOCKS_REPLACE 

3509   

3510 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

3511      if level == locking.LEVEL_NODE and self.do_locking: 
3512        self._LockInstancesNodes() 

3513   

3514 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

3515      """Check prerequisites. 
3516   
3517      """ 
3518      pass 

3519   

3520 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

3521      """Computes the list of nodes and their attributes. 
3522   
3523      """ 
3524      all_info = self.cfg.GetAllInstancesInfo() 
3525      if self.wanted == locking.ALL_SET: 
3526        # caller didn't specify instance names, so ordering is not important 
3527        if self.do_locking: 
3528          instance_names = self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] 
3529        else: 
3530          instance_names = all_info.keys() 
3531        instance_names = utils.NiceSort(instance_names) 
3532      else: 
3533        # caller did specify names, so we must keep the ordering 
3534        if self.do_locking: 
3535          tgt_set = self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] 
3536        else: 
3537          tgt_set = all_info.keys() 
3538        missing = set(self.wanted).difference(tgt_set) 
3539        if missing: 
3540          raise errors.OpExecError("Some instances were removed before" 
3541                                   " retrieving their data: %s" % missing) 
3542        instance_names = self.wanted 
3543   
3544      instance_list = [all_info[iname] for iname in instance_names] 
3545   
3546      # begin data gathering 
3547   
3548      nodes = frozenset([inst.primary_node for inst in instance_list]) 
3549      hv_list = list(set([inst.hypervisor for inst in instance_list])) 
3550   
3551      bad_nodes = [] 
3552      off_nodes = [] 
3553      if self.do_node_query: 
3554        live_data = {} 
3555        node_data = self.rpc.call_all_instances_info(nodes, hv_list) 
3556        for name in nodes: 
3557          result = node_data[name] 
3558          if result.offline: 
3559            # offline nodes will be in both lists 
3560            off_nodes.append(name) 
3561          if result.failed: 
3562            bad_nodes.append(name) 
3563          else: 
3564            if result.data: 
3565              live_data.update(result.data) 
3566              # else no instance is alive 
3567      else: 
3568        live_data = dict([(name, {}) for name in instance_names]) 
3569   
3570      # end data gathering 
3571   
3572      HVPREFIX = "hv/" 
3573      BEPREFIX = "be/" 
3574      output = [] 
3575      for instance in instance_list: 
3576        iout = [] 
3577        i_hv = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().FillHV(instance) 
3578        i_be = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().FillBE(instance) 
3579        for field in self.op.output_fields: 
3580          st_match = self._FIELDS_STATIC.Matches(field) 
3581          if field == "name": 
3582            val = instance.name 
3583          elif field == "os": 
3584            val = instance.os 
3585          elif field == "pnode": 
3586            val = instance.primary_node 
3587          elif field == "snodes": 
3588            val = list(instance.secondary_nodes) 
3589          elif field == "admin_state": 
3590            val = instance.admin_up 
3591          elif field == "oper_state": 
3592            if instance.primary_node in bad_nodes: 
3593              val = None 
3594            else: 
3595              val = bool(live_data.get(instance.name)) 
3596          elif field == "status": 
3597            if instance.primary_node in off_nodes: 
3598              val = "ERROR_nodeoffline" 
3599            elif instance.primary_node in bad_nodes: 
3600              val = "ERROR_nodedown" 
3601            else: 
3602              running = bool(live_data.get(instance.name)) 
3603              if running: 
3604                if instance.admin_up: 
3605                  val = "running" 
3606                else: 
3607                  val = "ERROR_up" 
3608              else: 
3609                if instance.admin_up: 
3610                  val = "ERROR_down" 
3611                else: 
3612                  val = "ADMIN_down" 
3613          elif field == "oper_ram": 
3614            if instance.primary_node in bad_nodes: 
3615              val = None 
3616            elif instance.name in live_data: 
3617              val = live_data[instance.name].get("memory", "?") 
3618            else: 
3619              val = "-" 
3620          elif field == "vcpus": 
3621            val = i_be[constants.BE_VCPUS] 
3622          elif field == "disk_template": 
3623            val = instance.disk_template 
3624          elif field == "ip": 
3625            if instance.nics: 
3626              val = instance.nics[0].ip 
3627            else: 
3628              val = None 
3629          elif field == "bridge": 
3630            if instance.nics: 
3631              val = instance.nics[0].bridge 
3632            else: 
3633              val = None 
3634          elif field == "mac": 
3635            if instance.nics: 
3636              val = instance.nics[0].mac 
3637            else: 
3638              val = None 
3639          elif field == "sda_size" or field == "sdb_size": 
3640            idx = ord(field[2]) - ord('a') 
3641            try: 
3642              val = instance.FindDisk(idx).size 
3643            except errors.OpPrereqError: 
3644              val = None 
3645          elif field == "disk_usage": # total disk usage per node 
3646            disk_sizes = [{'size': disk.size} for disk in instance.disks] 
3647            val = _ComputeDiskSize(instance.disk_template, disk_sizes) 
3648          elif field == "tags": 
3649            val = list(instance.GetTags()) 
3650          elif field == "serial_no": 
3651            val = instance.serial_no 
3652          elif field == "network_port": 
3653            val = instance.network_port 
3654          elif field == "hypervisor": 
3655            val = instance.hypervisor 
3656          elif field == "hvparams": 
3657            val = i_hv 
3658          elif (field.startswith(HVPREFIX) and 
3659                field[len(HVPREFIX):] in constants.HVS_PARAMETERS): 
3660            val = i_hv.get(field[len(HVPREFIX):], None) 
3661          elif field == "beparams": 
3662            val = i_be 
3663          elif (field.startswith(BEPREFIX) and 
3664                field[len(BEPREFIX):] in constants.BES_PARAMETERS): 
3665            val = i_be.get(field[len(BEPREFIX):], None) 
3666          elif st_match and st_match.groups(): 
3667            # matches a variable list 
3668            st_groups = st_match.groups() 
3669            if st_groups and st_groups[0] == "disk": 
3670              if st_groups[1] == "count": 
3671                val = len(instance.disks) 
3672              elif st_groups[1] == "sizes": 
3673                val = [disk.size for disk in instance.disks] 
3674              elif st_groups[1] == "size": 
3675                try: 
3676                  val = instance.FindDisk(st_groups[2]).size 
3677                except errors.OpPrereqError: 
3678                  val = None 
3679              else: 
3680                assert False, "Unhandled disk parameter" 
3681            elif st_groups[0] == "nic": 
3682              if st_groups[1] == "count": 
3683                val = len(instance.nics) 
3684              elif st_groups[1] == "macs": 
3685                val = [nic.mac for nic in instance.nics] 
3686              elif st_groups[1] == "ips": 
3687                val = [nic.ip for nic in instance.nics] 
3688              elif st_groups[1] == "bridges": 
3689                val = [nic.bridge for nic in instance.nics] 
3690              else: 
3691                # index-based item 
3692                nic_idx = int(st_groups[2]) 
3693                if nic_idx >= len(instance.nics): 
3694                  val = None 
3695                else: 
3696                  if st_groups[1] == "mac": 
3697                    val = instance.nics[nic_idx].mac 
3698                  elif st_groups[1] == "ip": 
3699                    val = instance.nics[nic_idx].ip 
3700                  elif st_groups[1] == "bridge": 
3701                    val = instance.nics[nic_idx].bridge 
3702                  else: 
3703                    assert False, "Unhandled NIC parameter" 
3704            else: 
3705              assert False, ("Declared but unhandled variable parameter '%s'" % 
3706                             field) 
3707          else: 
3708            assert False, "Declared but unhandled parameter '%s'" % field 
3709          iout.append(val) 
3710        output.append(iout) 
3711   
3712      return output 

3713

3733 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self):

3737   
3738      """

3741        } 
3742      env.update(_BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, self.instance))

3746 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

3747      """Check prerequisites. 
3748   
3749      This checks that the instance is in the cluster. 
3750   
3751      """ 
3752      self.instance = instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.op.instance_name) 
3753      assert self.instance is not None, \ 
3754        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
3755   
3756      bep = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().FillBE(instance) 
3757      if instance.disk_template not in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
3758        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance's disk layout is not" 
3759                                   " network mirrored, cannot failover.") 
3760   
3761      secondary_nodes = instance.secondary_nodes 
3762      if not secondary_nodes: 
3763        raise errors.ProgrammerError("no secondary node but using " 
3764                                     "a mirrored disk template") 
3765   
3766      target_node = secondary_nodes[0] 
3767      _CheckNodeOnline(self, target_node) 
3768      _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, target_node) 
3769   
3770      if instance.admin_up: 
3771        # check memory requirements on the secondary node 
3772        _CheckNodeFreeMemory(self, target_node, "failing over instance %s" % 
3773                             instance.name, bep[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
3774                             instance.hypervisor) 
3775      else: 
3776        self.LogInfo("Not checking memory on the secondary node as" 
3777                     " instance will not be started") 
3778   
3779      # check bridge existence 
3780      brlist = [nic.bridge for nic in instance.nics] 
3781      result = self.rpc.call_bridges_exist(target_node, brlist) 
3782      result.Raise() 
3783      if not result.data: 
3784        raise errors.OpPrereqError("One or more target bridges %s does not" 
3785                                   " exist on destination node '%s'" % 
3786                                   (brlist, target_node)) 

3787   

3788 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

3789      """Failover an instance. 
3790   
3791      The failover is done by shutting it down on its present node and 
3792      starting it on the secondary. 
3793   
3794      """ 
3795      instance = self.instance 
3796   
3797      source_node = instance.primary_node 
3798      target_node = instance.secondary_nodes[0] 
3799   
3800      feedback_fn("* checking disk consistency between source and target") 
3801      for dev in instance.disks: 
3802        # for drbd, these are drbd over lvm 
3803        if not _CheckDiskConsistency(self, dev, target_node, False): 
3804          if instance.admin_up and not self.op.ignore_consistency: 
3805            raise errors.OpExecError("Disk %s is degraded on target node," 
3806                                     " aborting failover." % dev.iv_name) 
3807   
3808      feedback_fn("* shutting down instance on source node") 
3809      logging.info("Shutting down instance %s on node %s", 
3810                   instance.name, source_node) 
3811   
3812      result = self.rpc.call_instance_shutdown(source_node, instance) 
3813      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
3814      if msg: 
3815        if self.op.ignore_consistency: 
3816          self.proc.LogWarning("Could not shutdown instance %s on node %s." 
3817                               " Proceeding anyway. Please make sure node" 
3818                               " %s is down. Error details: %s", 
3819                               instance.name, source_node, source_node, msg) 
3820        else: 
3821          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not shutdown instance %s on" 
3822                                   " node %s: %s" % 
3823                                   (instance.name, source_node, msg)) 
3824   
3825      feedback_fn("* deactivating the instance's disks on source node") 
3826      if not _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance, ignore_primary=True): 
3827        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't shut down the instance's disks.") 
3828   
3829      instance.primary_node = target_node 
3830      # distribute new instance config to the other nodes 
3831      self.cfg.Update(instance) 
3832   
3833      # Only start the instance if it's marked as up 
3834      if instance.admin_up: 
3835        feedback_fn("* activating the instance's disks on target node") 
3836        logging.info("Starting instance %s on node %s", 
3837                     instance.name, target_node) 
3838   
3839        disks_ok, _ = _AssembleInstanceDisks(self, instance, 
3840                                                 ignore_secondaries=True) 
3841        if not disks_ok: 
3842          _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
3843          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't activate the instance's disks") 
3844   
3845        feedback_fn("* starting the instance on the target node") 
3846        result = self.rpc.call_instance_start(target_node, instance, None, None) 
3847        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
3848        if msg: 
3849          _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
3850          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not start instance %s on node %s: %s" % 
3851                                   (instance.name, target_node, msg)) 

3852   

3853

3895        self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.instance_name))

3898                                   self.op.instance_name)

3906        raise errors.ConfigurationError("No secondary node but using" 
3907                                        " drbd8 disk template")

3909      i_be = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo().FillBE(instance) 
3910   
3911      target_node = secondary_nodes[0] 
3912      # check memory requirements on the secondary node 
3913      _CheckNodeFreeMemory(self, target_node, "migrating instance %s" % 
3914                           instance.name, i_be[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
3915                           instance.hypervisor) 
3916

3918      brlist = [nic.bridge for nic in instance.nics] 
3919      result = self.rpc.call_bridges_exist(target_node, brlist) 
3920      if result.failed or not result.data: 
3921        raise errors.OpPrereqError("One or more target bridges %s does not" 
3922                                   " exist on destination node '%s'" % 
3923                                   (brlist, target_node)) 
3924   
3925      if not self.op.cleanup: 
3926        _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, target_node) 
3927        result = self.rpc.call_instance_migratable(instance.primary_node, 
3928                                                   instance) 
3929        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
3930        if msg: 
3931          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't migrate: %s - please use failover" %

3936 -  def _WaitUntilSync(self): 

3937      """Poll with custom rpc for disk sync. 
3938   
3939      This uses our own step-based rpc call. 
3940   
3941      """ 
3942      self.feedback_fn("* wait until resync is done") 
3943      all_done = False 
3944      while not all_done: 
3945        all_done = True 
3946        result = self.rpc.call_drbd_wait_sync(self.all_nodes, 
3947                                              self.nodes_ip, 
3948                                              self.instance.disks) 
3949        min_percent = 100 
3950        for node, nres in result.items(): 
3951          msg = nres.RemoteFailMsg() 
3952          if msg: 
3953            raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot resync disks on node %s: %s" % 
3954                                     (node, msg)) 
3955          node_done, node_percent = nres.payload 
3956          all_done = all_done and node_done 
3957          if node_percent is not None: 
3958            min_percent = min(min_percent, node_percent) 
3959        if not all_done: 
3960          if min_percent < 100: 
3961            self.feedback_fn("   - progress: %.1f%%" % min_percent) 
3962          time.sleep(2) 

3963   

3964 -  def _EnsureSecondary(self, node): 

3965      """Demote a node to secondary. 
3966   
3967      """ 
3968      self.feedback_fn("* switching node %s to secondary mode" % node) 
3969   
3970      for dev in self.instance.disks: 
3971        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node) 
3972   
3973      result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_close(node, self.instance.name, 
3974                                            self.instance.disks) 
3975      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
3976      if msg: 
3977        raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot change disk to secondary on node %s," 
3978                                 " error %s" % (node, msg)) 

3979   

3980 -  def _GoStandalone(self): 

3981      """Disconnect from the network. 
3982   
3983      """ 
3984      self.feedback_fn("* changing into standalone mode") 
3985      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_disconnect_net(self.all_nodes, self.nodes_ip, 
3986                                                 self.instance.disks) 
3987      for node, nres in result.items(): 
3988        msg = nres.RemoteFailMsg() 
3989        if msg: 
3990          raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot disconnect disks node %s," 
3991                                   " error %s" % (node, msg)) 

3992   

3993 -  def _GoReconnect(self, multimaster): 

3994      """Reconnect to the network. 
3995   
3996      """ 
3997      if multimaster: 
3998        msg = "dual-master" 
3999      else: 
4000        msg = "single-master" 
4001      self.feedback_fn("* changing disks into %s mode" % msg) 
4002      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_attach_net(self.all_nodes, self.nodes_ip, 
4003                                             self.instance.disks, 
4004                                             self.instance.name, multimaster) 
4005      for node, nres in result.items(): 
4006        msg = nres.RemoteFailMsg() 
4007        if msg: 
4008          raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot change disks config on node %s," 
4009                                   " error: %s" % (node, msg)) 

4010   

4011 -  def _ExecCleanup(self): 

4012      """Try to cleanup after a failed migration. 
4013   
4014      The cleanup is done by: 
4015        - check that the instance is running only on one node 
4016          (and update the config if needed) 
4017        - change disks on its secondary node to secondary 
4018        - wait until disks are fully synchronized 
4019        - disconnect from the network 
4020        - change disks into single-master mode 
4021        - wait again until disks are fully synchronized 
4022   
4023      """ 
4024      instance = self.instance 
4025      target_node = self.target_node 
4026      source_node = self.source_node 
4027   
4028      # check running on only one node 
4029      self.feedback_fn("* checking where the instance actually runs" 
4030                       " (if this hangs, the hypervisor might be in" 
4031                       " a bad state)") 
4032      ins_l = self.rpc.call_instance_list(self.all_nodes, [instance.hypervisor]) 
4033      for node, result in ins_l.items(): 
4034        result.Raise() 
4035        if not isinstance(result.data, list): 
4036          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't contact node '%s'" % node) 
4037   
4038      runningon_source = instance.name in ins_l[source_node].data 
4039      runningon_target = instance.name in ins_l[target_node].data 
4040   
4041      if runningon_source and runningon_target: 
4042        raise errors.OpExecError("Instance seems to be running on two nodes," 
4043                                 " or the hypervisor is confused. You will have" 
4044                                 " to ensure manually that it runs only on one" 
4045                                 " and restart this operation.") 
4046   
4047      if not (runningon_source or runningon_target): 
4048        raise errors.OpExecError("Instance does not seem to be running at all." 
4049                                 " In this case, it's safer to repair by" 
4050                                 " running 'gnt-instance stop' to ensure disk" 
4051                                 " shutdown, and then restarting it.") 
4052   
4053      if runningon_target: 
4054        # the migration has actually succeeded, we need to update the config 
4055        self.feedback_fn("* instance running on secondary node (%s)," 
4056                         " updating config" % target_node) 
4057        instance.primary_node = target_node 
4058        self.cfg.Update(instance) 
4059        demoted_node = source_node 
4060      else: 
4061        self.feedback_fn("* instance confirmed to be running on its" 
4062                         " primary node (%s)" % source_node) 
4063        demoted_node = target_node 
4064   
4065      self._EnsureSecondary(demoted_node) 
4066      try: 
4067        self._WaitUntilSync() 
4068      except errors.OpExecError: 
4069        # we ignore here errors, since if the device is standalone, it 
4070        # won't be able to sync 
4071        pass 
4072      self._GoStandalone() 
4073      self._GoReconnect(False) 
4074      self._WaitUntilSync() 
4075   
4076      self.feedback_fn("* done") 

4077   

4078 -  def _RevertDiskStatus(self): 

4079      """Try to revert the disk status after a failed migration. 
4080   
4081      """ 
4082      target_node = self.target_node 
4083      try: 
4084        self._EnsureSecondary(target_node) 
4085        self._GoStandalone() 
4086        self._GoReconnect(False) 
4087        self._WaitUntilSync() 
4088      except errors.OpExecError, err: 
4089        self.LogWarning("Migration failed and I can't reconnect the" 
4090                        " drives: error '%s'\n" 
4091                        "Please look and recover the instance status" % 
4092                        str(err)) 

4093   

4094 -  def _AbortMigration(self): 

4095      """Call the hypervisor code to abort a started migration. 
4096   
4097      """ 
4098      instance = self.instance 
4099      target_node = self.target_node 
4100      migration_info = self.migration_info 
4101   
4102      abort_result = self.rpc.call_finalize_migration(target_node, 
4103                                                      instance, 
4104                                                      migration_info, 
4105                                                      False) 
4106      abort_msg = abort_result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4107      if abort_msg: 
4108        logging.error("Aborting migration failed on target node %s: %s" % 
4109                      (target_node, abort_msg)) 

4110        # Don't raise an exception here, as we stil have to try to revert the 
4111        # disk status, even if this step failed. 
4112   

4113 -  def _ExecMigration(self): 

4114      """Migrate an instance. 
4115   
4116      The migrate is done by: 
4117        - change the disks into dual-master mode 
4118        - wait until disks are fully synchronized again 
4119        - migrate the instance 
4120        - change disks on the new secondary node (the old primary) to secondary 
4121        - wait until disks are fully synchronized 
4122        - change disks into single-master mode 
4123   
4124      """ 
4125      instance = self.instance 
4126      target_node = self.target_node 
4127      source_node = self.source_node 
4128   
4129      self.feedback_fn("* checking disk consistency between source and target") 
4130      for dev in instance.disks: 
4131        if not _CheckDiskConsistency(self, dev, target_node, False): 
4132          raise errors.OpExecError("Disk %s is degraded or not fully" 
4133                                   " synchronized on target node," 
4134                                   " aborting migrate." % dev.iv_name) 
4135   
4136      # First get the migration information from the remote node 
4137      result = self.rpc.call_migration_info(source_node, instance) 
4138      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4139      if msg: 
4140        log_err = ("Failed fetching source migration information from %s: %s" % 
4141                   (source_node, msg)) 
4142        logging.error(log_err) 
4143        raise errors.OpExecError(log_err) 
4144   
4145      self.migration_info = migration_info = result.payload 
4146   
4147      # Then switch the disks to master/master mode 
4148      self._EnsureSecondary(target_node) 
4149      self._GoStandalone() 
4150      self._GoReconnect(True) 
4151      self._WaitUntilSync() 
4152   
4153      self.feedback_fn("* preparing %s to accept the instance" % target_node) 
4154      result = self.rpc.call_accept_instance(target_node, 
4155                                             instance, 
4156                                             migration_info, 
4157                                             self.nodes_ip[target_node]) 
4158   
4159      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4160      if msg: 
4161        logging.error("Instance pre-migration failed, trying to revert" 
4162                      " disk status: %s", msg) 
4163        self._AbortMigration() 
4164        self._RevertDiskStatus() 
4165        raise errors.OpExecError("Could not pre-migrate instance %s: %s" % 
4166                                 (instance.name, msg)) 
4167   
4168      self.feedback_fn("* migrating instance to %s" % target_node) 
4169      time.sleep(10) 
4170      result = self.rpc.call_instance_migrate(source_node, instance, 
4171                                              self.nodes_ip[target_node], 
4172                                              self.op.live) 
4173      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4174      if msg: 
4175        logging.error("Instance migration failed, trying to revert" 
4176                      " disk status: %s", msg) 
4177        self._AbortMigration() 
4178        self._RevertDiskStatus() 
4179        raise errors.OpExecError("Could not migrate instance %s: %s" % 
4180                                 (instance.name, msg)) 
4181      time.sleep(10) 
4182   
4183      instance.primary_node = target_node 
4184      # distribute new instance config to the other nodes 
4185      self.cfg.Update(instance) 
4186   
4187      result = self.rpc.call_finalize_migration(target_node, 
4188                                                instance, 
4189                                                migration_info, 
4190                                                True) 
4191      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4192      if msg: 
4193        logging.error("Instance migration succeeded, but finalization failed:" 
4194                      " %s" % msg) 
4195        raise errors.OpExecError("Could not finalize instance migration: %s" % 
4196                                 msg) 
4197   
4198      self._EnsureSecondary(source_node) 
4199      self._WaitUntilSync() 
4200      self._GoStandalone() 
4201      self._GoReconnect(False) 
4202      self._WaitUntilSync() 
4203   
4204      self.feedback_fn("* done") 

4205   

4206 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

4207      """Perform the migration. 
4208   
4209      """ 
4210      self.feedback_fn = feedback_fn 
4211   
4212      self.source_node = self.instance.primary_node 
4213      self.target_node = self.instance.secondary_nodes[0] 
4214      self.all_nodes = [self.source_node, self.target_node] 
4215      self.nodes_ip = { 
4216        self.source_node: self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.source_node).secondary_ip, 
4217        self.target_node: self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.target_node).secondary_ip, 
4218        } 
4219      if self.op.cleanup: 
4220        return self._ExecCleanup() 
4221      else: 
4222        return self._ExecMigration() 

4223   

4224   
4225 -def _CreateBlockDev(lu, node, instance, device, force_create, 
4226                      info, force_open): 

4227    """Create a tree of block devices on a given node. 
4228   
4229    If this device type has to be created on secondaries, create it and 
4230    all its children. 
4231   
4232    If not, just recurse to children keeping the same 'force' value. 
4233   
4234    @param lu: the lu on whose behalf we execute 
4235    @param node: the node on which to create the device 
4236    @type instance: L{objects.Instance} 
4237    @param instance: the instance which owns the device 
4238    @type device: L{objects.Disk} 
4239    @param device: the device to create 
4240    @type force_create: boolean 
4241    @param force_create: whether to force creation of this device; this 
4242        will be change to True whenever we find a device which has 
4243        CreateOnSecondary() attribute 
4244    @param info: the extra 'metadata' we should attach to the device 
4245        (this will be represented as a LVM tag) 
4246    @type force_open: boolean 
4247    @param force_open: this parameter will be passes to the 
4248        L{backend.BlockdevCreate} function where it specifies 
4249        whether we run on primary or not, and it affects both 
4250        the child assembly and the device own Open() execution 
4251   
4252    """ 
4253    if device.CreateOnSecondary(): 
4254      force_create = True 
4255   
4256    if device.children: 
4257      for child in device.children: 
4258        _CreateBlockDev(lu, node, instance, child, force_create, 
4259                        info, force_open) 
4260   
4261    if not force_create: 
4262      return 
4263   
4264    _CreateSingleBlockDev(lu, node, instance, device, info, force_open) 

4265   

4266   
4267 -def _CreateSingleBlockDev(lu, node, instance, device, info, force_open): 

4268    """Create a single block device on a given node. 
4269   
4270    This will not recurse over children of the device, so they must be 
4271    created in advance. 
4272   
4273    @param lu: the lu on whose behalf we execute 
4274    @param node: the node on which to create the device 
4275    @type instance: L{objects.Instance} 
4276    @param instance: the instance which owns the device 
4277    @type device: L{objects.Disk} 
4278    @param device: the device to create 
4279    @param info: the extra 'metadata' we should attach to the device 
4280        (this will be represented as a LVM tag) 
4281    @type force_open: boolean 
4282    @param force_open: this parameter will be passes to the 
4283        L{backend.BlockdevCreate} function where it specifies 
4284        whether we run on primary or not, and it affects both 
4285        the child assembly and the device own Open() execution 
4286   
4287    """ 
4288    lu.cfg.SetDiskID(device, node) 
4289    result = lu.rpc.call_blockdev_create(node, device, device.size, 
4290                                         instance.name, force_open, info) 
4291    msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
4292    if msg: 
4293      raise errors.OpExecError("Can't create block device %s on" 
4294                               " node %s for instance %s: %s" % 
4295                               (device, node, instance.name, msg)) 
4296    if device.physical_id is None: 
4297      device.physical_id = result.payload 

4298

4300 -def _GenerateUniqueNames(lu, exts): 

4301    """Generate a suitable LV name. 
4302   
4303    This will generate a logical volume name for the given instance. 
4304   
4305    """ 
4306    results = [] 
4307    for val in exts: 
4308      new_id = lu.cfg.GenerateUniqueID() 
4309      results.append("%s%s" % (new_id, val)) 
4310    return results

4313 -def _GenerateDRBD8Branch(lu, primary, secondary, size, names, iv_name, 
4314                           p_minor, s_minor): 

4315    """Generate a drbd8 device complete with its children. 
4316   
4317    """ 
4318    port = lu.cfg.AllocatePort() 
4319    vgname = lu.cfg.GetVGName() 
4320    shared_secret = lu.cfg.GenerateDRBDSecret() 
4321    dev_data = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=size, 
4322                            logical_id=(vgname, names[0])) 
4323    dev_meta = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=128, 
4324                            logical_id=(vgname, names[1])) 
4325    drbd_dev = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_DRBD8, size=size, 
4326                            logical_id=(primary, secondary, port, 
4327                                        p_minor, s_minor, 
4328                                        shared_secret), 
4329                            children=[dev_data, dev_meta], 
4330                            iv_name=iv_name) 
4331    return drbd_dev

4333   
4334 -def _GenerateDiskTemplate(lu, template_name, 
4335                            instance_name, primary_node, 
4336                            secondary_nodes, disk_info, 
4337                            file_storage_dir, file_driver, 
4338                            base_index): 

4339    """Generate the entire disk layout for a given template type. 
4340   
4341    """ 
4342    #TODO: compute space requirements 
4343   
4344    vgname = lu.cfg.GetVGName() 
4345    disk_count = len(disk_info) 
4346    disks = [] 
4347    if template_name == constants.DT_DISKLESS: 
4348      pass 
4349    elif template_name == constants.DT_PLAIN: 
4350      if len(secondary_nodes) != 0: 
4351        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Wrong template configuration") 
4352   
4353      names = _GenerateUniqueNames(lu, [".disk%d" % (base_index + i) 
4354                                        for i in range(disk_count)]) 
4355      for idx, disk in enumerate(disk_info): 
4356        disk_index = idx + base_index 
4357        disk_dev = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=disk["size"], 
4358                                logical_id=(vgname, names[idx]), 
4359                                iv_name="disk/%d" % disk_index, 
4360                                mode=disk["mode"]) 
4361        disks.append(disk_dev) 
4362    elif template_name == constants.DT_DRBD8: 
4363      if len(secondary_nodes) != 1: 
4364        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Wrong template configuration") 
4365      remote_node = secondary_nodes[0] 
4366      minors = lu.cfg.AllocateDRBDMinor( 
4367        [primary_node, remote_node] * len(disk_info), instance_name) 
4368   
4369      names = [] 
4370      for lv_prefix in _GenerateUniqueNames(lu, [".disk%d" % (base_index + i) 
4371                                                 for i in range(disk_count)]): 
4372        names.append(lv_prefix + "_data") 
4373        names.append(lv_prefix + "_meta") 
4374      for idx, disk in enumerate(disk_info): 
4375        disk_index = idx + base_index 
4376        disk_dev = _GenerateDRBD8Branch(lu, primary_node, remote_node, 
4377                                        disk["size"], names[idx*2:idx*2+2], 
4378                                        "disk/%d" % disk_index, 
4379                                        minors[idx*2], minors[idx*2+1]) 
4380        disk_dev.mode = disk["mode"] 
4381        disks.append(disk_dev) 
4382    elif template_name == constants.DT_FILE: 
4383      if len(secondary_nodes) != 0: 
4384        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Wrong template configuration") 
4385   
4386      for idx, disk in enumerate(disk_info): 
4387        disk_index = idx + base_index 
4388        disk_dev = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_FILE, size=disk["size"], 
4389                                iv_name="disk/%d" % disk_index, 
4390                                logical_id=(file_driver, 
4391                                            "%s/disk%d" % (file_storage_dir, 
4392                                                           disk_index)), 
4393                                mode=disk["mode"]) 
4394        disks.append(disk_dev) 
4395    else: 
4396      raise errors.ProgrammerError("Invalid disk template '%s'" % template_name) 
4397    return disks

4407 -def _CreateDisks(lu, instance): 

4408    """Create all disks for an instance. 
4409   
4410    This abstracts away some work from AddInstance. 
4411   
4412    @type lu: L{LogicalUnit} 
4413    @param lu: the logical unit on whose behalf we execute 
4414    @type instance: L{objects.Instance} 
4415    @param instance: the instance whose disks we should create 
4416    @rtype: boolean 
4417    @return: the success of the creation 
4418   
4419    """ 
4420    info = _GetInstanceInfoText(instance) 
4421    pnode = instance.primary_node 
4422   
4423    if instance.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
4424      file_storage_dir = os.path.dirname(instance.disks[0].logical_id[1]) 
4425      result = lu.rpc.call_file_storage_dir_create(pnode, file_storage_dir) 
4426   
4427      if result.failed or not result.data: 
4428        raise errors.OpExecError("Could not connect to node '%s'" % pnode) 
4429   
4430      if not result.data[0]: 
4431        raise errors.OpExecError("Failed to create directory '%s'" % 
4432                                 file_storage_dir)

4435    # LUSetInstanceParams

4438                   device.iv_name, instance.name)

4441        f_create = node == pnode 
4442        _CreateBlockDev(lu, node, instance, device, f_create, info, f_create)

4444   
4445 -def _RemoveDisks(lu, instance): 

4446    """Remove all disks for an instance. 
4447   
4448    This abstracts away some work from `AddInstance()` and 
4449    `RemoveInstance()`. Note that in case some of the devices couldn't 
4450    be removed, the removal will continue with the other ones (compare 
4451    with `_CreateDisks()`). 
4452   
4453    @type lu: L{LogicalUnit} 
4454    @param lu: the logical unit on whose behalf we execute 
4455    @type instance: L{objects.Instance} 
4456    @param instance: the instance whose disks we should remove 
4457    @rtype: boolean 
4458    @return: the success of the removal 
4459   
4460    """ 
4461    logging.info("Removing block devices for instance %s", instance.name) 
4462   
4463    all_result = True 
4464    for device in instance.disks: 
4465      for node, disk in device.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
4466        lu.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, node) 
4467        msg = lu.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(node, disk).RemoteFailMsg() 
4468        if msg: 
4469          lu.LogWarning("Could not remove block device %s on node %s," 
4470                        " continuing anyway: %s", device.iv_name, node, msg) 
4471          all_result = False 
4472   
4473    if instance.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
4474      file_storage_dir = os.path.dirname(instance.disks[0].logical_id[1]) 
4475      result = lu.rpc.call_file_storage_dir_remove(instance.primary_node, 
4476                                                   file_storage_dir) 
4477      if result.failed or not result.data: 
4478        logging.error("Could not remove directory '%s'", file_storage_dir) 
4479        all_result = False 
4480   
4481    return all_result 

4482   

4483   
4484 -def _ComputeDiskSize(disk_template, disks): 

4485    """Compute disk size requirements in the volume group 
4486   
4487    """ 
4488    # Required free disk space as a function of disk and swap space 
4489    req_size_dict = { 
4490      constants.DT_DISKLESS: None, 
4491      constants.DT_PLAIN: sum(d["size"] for d in disks), 
4492      # 128 MB are added for drbd metadata for each disk 
4493      constants.DT_DRBD8: sum(d["size"] + 128 for d in disks), 
4494      constants.DT_FILE: None, 
4495    } 
4496   
4497    if disk_template not in req_size_dict: 
4498      raise errors.ProgrammerError("Disk template '%s' size requirement" 
4499                                   " is unknown" %  disk_template) 
4500   
4501    return req_size_dict[disk_template]

4504 -def _CheckHVParams(lu, nodenames, hvname, hvparams): 

4505    """Hypervisor parameter validation. 
4506   
4507    This function abstract the hypervisor parameter validation to be 
4508    used in both instance create and instance modify. 
4509   
4510    @type lu: L{LogicalUnit} 
4511    @param lu: the logical unit for which we check 
4512    @type nodenames: list 
4513    @param nodenames: the list of nodes on which we should check 
4514    @type hvname: string 
4515    @param hvname: the name of the hypervisor we should use 
4516    @type hvparams: dict 
4517    @param hvparams: the parameters which we need to check 
4518    @raise errors.OpPrereqError: if the parameters are not valid 
4519   
4520    """ 
4521    hvinfo = lu.rpc.call_hypervisor_validate_params(nodenames, 
4522                                                    hvname, 
4523                                                    hvparams) 
4524    for node in nodenames: 
4525      info = hvinfo[node] 
4526      if info.offline: 
4527        continue 
4528      msg = info.RemoteFailMsg() 
4529      if msg: 
4530        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Hypervisor parameter validation" 
4531                                   " failed on node %s: %s" % (node, msg))
