4555 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

4556      """ExpandNames for CreateInstance. 
4557   
4558      Figure out the right locks for instance creation. 
4559   
4560      """ 
4561      self.needed_locks = {} 
4562   
4563      # set optional parameters to none if they don't exist 
4564      for attr in ["pnode", "snode", "iallocator", "hypervisor"]: 
4565        if not hasattr(self.op, attr): 
4566          setattr(self.op, attr, None) 
4567   
4568      # cheap checks, mostly valid constants given 
4569   
4570      # verify creation mode 
4571      if self.op.mode not in (constants.INSTANCE_CREATE, 
4572                              constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT): 
4573        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid instance creation mode '%s'" % 
4574                                   self.op.mode) 
4575   
4576      # disk template and mirror node verification 
4577      if self.op.disk_template not in constants.DISK_TEMPLATES: 
4578        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk template name") 
4579   
4580      if self.op.hypervisor is None: 
4581        self.op.hypervisor = self.cfg.GetHypervisorType() 
4582   
4583      cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
4584      enabled_hvs = cluster.enabled_hypervisors 
4585      if self.op.hypervisor not in enabled_hvs: 
4586        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Selected hypervisor (%s) not enabled in the" 
4587                                   " cluster (%s)" % (self.op.hypervisor, 
4588                                    ",".join(enabled_hvs))) 
4589   
4590      # check hypervisor parameter syntax (locally) 
4591      utils.ForceDictType(self.op.hvparams, constants.HVS_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
4592      filled_hvp = cluster.FillDict(cluster.hvparams[self.op.hypervisor], 
4593                                    self.op.hvparams) 
4594      hv_type = hypervisor.GetHypervisor(self.op.hypervisor) 
4595      hv_type.CheckParameterSyntax(filled_hvp) 
4596      self.hv_full = filled_hvp 
4597   
4598      # fill and remember the beparams dict 
4599      utils.ForceDictType(self.op.beparams, constants.BES_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
4600      self.be_full = cluster.FillDict(cluster.beparams[constants.BEGR_DEFAULT], 
4601                                      self.op.beparams) 
4602   
4603      #### instance parameters check 
4604   
4605      # instance name verification 
4606      hostname1 = utils.HostInfo(self.op.instance_name) 
4607      self.op.instance_name = instance_name = hostname1.name 
4608   
4609      # this is just a preventive check, but someone might still add this 
4610      # instance in the meantime, and creation will fail at lock-add time 
4611      if instance_name in self.cfg.GetInstanceList(): 
4612        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' is already in the cluster" % 
4613                                   instance_name) 
4614   
4615      self.add_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = instance_name 
4616   
4617      # NIC buildup 
4618      self.nics = [] 
4619      for nic in self.op.nics: 
4620        # ip validity checks 
4621        ip = nic.get("ip", None) 
4622        if ip is None or ip.lower() == "none": 
4623          nic_ip = None 
4624        elif ip.lower() == constants.VALUE_AUTO: 
4625          nic_ip = hostname1.ip 
4626        else: 
4627          if not utils.IsValidIP(ip): 
4628            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Given IP address '%s' doesn't look" 
4629                                       " like a valid IP" % ip) 
4630          nic_ip = ip 
4631   
4632        # MAC address verification 
4633        mac = nic.get("mac", constants.VALUE_AUTO) 
4634        if mac not in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
4635          if not utils.IsValidMac(mac.lower()): 
4636            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid MAC address specified: %s" % 
4637                                       mac) 
4638          else: 
4639            # or validate/reserve the current one 
4640            if self.cfg.IsMacInUse(mac): 
4641              raise errors.OpPrereqError("MAC address %s already in use" 
4642                                         " in cluster" % mac) 
4643   
4644        # bridge verification 
4645        bridge = nic.get("bridge", None) 
4646        if bridge is None: 
4647          bridge = self.cfg.GetDefBridge() 
4648        self.nics.append(objects.NIC(mac=mac, ip=nic_ip, bridge=bridge)) 
4649   
4650      # disk checks/pre-build 
4651      self.disks = [] 
4652      for disk in self.op.disks: 
4653        mode = disk.get("mode", constants.DISK_RDWR) 
4654        if mode not in constants.DISK_ACCESS_SET: 
4655          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk access mode '%s'" % 
4656                                     mode) 
4657        size = disk.get("size", None) 
4658        if size is None: 
4659          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing disk size") 
4660        try: 
4661          size = int(size) 
4662        except (TypeError, ValueError): 
4663          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk size '%s'" % size) 
4664        self.disks.append({"size": size, "mode": mode}) 
4665   
4666      # used in CheckPrereq for ip ping check 
4667      self.check_ip = hostname1.ip 
4668   
4669      # file storage checks 
4670      if (self.op.file_driver and 
4671          not self.op.file_driver in constants.FILE_DRIVER): 
4672        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid file driver name '%s'" % 
4673                                   self.op.file_driver) 
4674   
4675      if self.op.file_storage_dir and os.path.isabs(self.op.file_storage_dir): 
4676        raise errors.OpPrereqError("File storage directory path not absolute") 
4677   
4678      ### Node/iallocator related checks 
4679      if [self.op.iallocator, self.op.pnode].count(None) != 1: 
4680        raise errors.OpPrereqError("One and only one of iallocator and primary" 
4681                                   " node must be given") 
4682   
4683      if self.op.iallocator: 
4684        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET 
4685      else: 
4686        self.op.pnode = self._ExpandNode(self.op.pnode) 
4687        nodelist = [self.op.pnode] 
4688        if self.op.snode is not None: 
4689          self.op.snode = self._ExpandNode(self.op.snode) 
4690          nodelist.append(self.op.snode) 
4691        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = nodelist 
4692   
4693      # in case of import lock the source node too 
4694      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
4695        src_node = getattr(self.op, "src_node", None) 
4696        src_path = getattr(self.op, "src_path", None) 
4697   
4698        if src_path is None: 
4699          self.op.src_path = src_path = self.op.instance_name 
4700   
4701        if src_node is None: 
4702          self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET 
4703          self.op.src_node = None 
4704          if os.path.isabs(src_path): 
4705            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Importing an instance from an absolute" 
4706                                       " path requires a source node option.") 
4707        else: 
4708          self.op.src_node = src_node = self._ExpandNode(src_node) 
4709          if self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] is not locking.ALL_SET: 
4710            self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE].append(src_node) 
4711          if not os.path.isabs(src_path): 
4712            self.op.src_path = src_path = \ 
4713              os.path.join(constants.EXPORT_DIR, src_path) 
4714   
4715      else: # INSTANCE_CREATE 
4716        if getattr(self.op, "os_type", None) is None: 
4717          raise errors.OpPrereqError("No guest OS specified") 

4718   

4719 -  def _RunAllocator(self): 

4720      """Run the allocator based on input opcode. 
4721   
4722      """ 
4723      nics = [n.ToDict() for n in self.nics] 
4724      ial = IAllocator(self, 
4725                       mode=constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC, 
4726                       name=self.op.instance_name, 
4727                       disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
4728                       tags=[], 
4729                       os=self.op.os_type, 
4730                       vcpus=self.be_full[constants.BE_VCPUS], 
4731                       mem_size=self.be_full[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
4732                       disks=self.disks, 
4733                       nics=nics, 
4734                       hypervisor=self.op.hypervisor, 
4735                       ) 
4736   
4737      ial.Run(self.op.iallocator) 
4738   
4739      if not ial.success: 
4740        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute nodes using" 
4741                                   " iallocator '%s': %s" % (self.op.iallocator, 
4742                                                             ial.info)) 
4743      if len(ial.nodes) != ial.required_nodes: 
4744        raise errors.OpPrereqError("iallocator '%s' returned invalid number" 
4745                                   " of nodes (%s), required %s" % 
4746                                   (self.op.iallocator, len(ial.nodes), 
4747                                    ial.required_nodes)) 
4748      self.op.pnode = ial.nodes[0] 
4749      self.LogInfo("Selected nodes for instance %s via iallocator %s: %s", 
4750                   self.op.instance_name, self.op.iallocator, 
4751                   ", ".join(ial.nodes)) 
4752      if ial.required_nodes == 2: 
4753        self.op.snode = ial.nodes[1]

4755 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

4756      """Build hooks env. 
4757   
4758      This runs on master, primary and secondary nodes of the instance. 
4759   
4760      """ 
4761      env = { 
4762        "ADD_MODE": self.op.mode, 
4763        } 
4764      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
4765        env["SRC_NODE"] = self.op.src_node 
4766        env["SRC_PATH"] = self.op.src_path 
4767        env["SRC_IMAGES"] = self.src_images 
4768   
4769      env.update(_BuildInstanceHookEnv( 
4770        name=self.op.instance_name, 
4771        primary_node=self.op.pnode, 
4772        secondary_nodes=self.secondaries, 
4773        status=self.op.start, 
4774        os_type=self.op.os_type, 
4775        memory=self.be_full[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
4776        vcpus=self.be_full[constants.BE_VCPUS], 
4777        nics=[(n.ip, n.bridge, n.mac) for n in self.nics], 
4778        disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
4779        disks=[(d["size"], d["mode"]) for d in self.disks], 
4780        bep=self.be_full, 
4781        hvp=self.hv_full, 
4782        hypervisor_name=self.op.hypervisor, 
4783      )) 
4784   
4785      nl = ([self.cfg.GetMasterNode(), self.op.pnode] + 
4786            self.secondaries) 
4787      return env, nl, nl

4790 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

4791      """Check prerequisites. 
4792   
4793      """ 
4794      if (not self.cfg.GetVGName() and 
4795          self.op.disk_template not in constants.DTS_NOT_LVM): 
4796        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cluster does not support lvm-based" 
4797                                   " instances") 
4798   
4799      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
4800        src_node = self.op.src_node 
4801        src_path = self.op.src_path 
4802   
4803        if src_node is None: 
4804          exp_list = self.rpc.call_export_list( 
4805            self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE]) 
4806          found = False 
4807          for node in exp_list: 
4808            if not exp_list[node].failed and src_path in exp_list[node].data: 
4809              found = True 
4810              self.op.src_node = src_node = node 
4811              self.op.src_path = src_path = os.path.join(constants.EXPORT_DIR, 
4812                                                         src_path) 
4813              break 
4814          if not found: 
4815            raise errors.OpPrereqError("No export found for relative path %s" % 
4816                                        src_path) 
4817   
4818        _CheckNodeOnline(self, src_node) 
4819        result = self.rpc.call_export_info(src_node, src_path) 
4820        result.Raise() 
4821        if not result.data: 
4822          raise errors.OpPrereqError("No export found in dir %s" % src_path) 
4823   
4824        export_info = result.data 
4825        if not export_info.has_section(constants.INISECT_EXP): 
4826          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Corrupted export config") 
4827   
4828        ei_version = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_EXP, 'version') 
4829        if (int(ei_version) != constants.EXPORT_VERSION): 
4830          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Wrong export version %s (wanted %d)" % 
4831                                     (ei_version, constants.EXPORT_VERSION)) 
4832   
4833        # Check that the new instance doesn't have less disks than the export 
4834        instance_disks = len(self.disks) 
4835        export_disks = export_info.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, 'disk_count') 
4836        if instance_disks < export_disks: 
4837          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Not enough disks to import." 
4838                                     " (instance: %d, export: %d)" % 
4839                                     (instance_disks, export_disks)) 
4840   
4841        self.op.os_type = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_EXP, 'os') 
4842        disk_images = [] 
4843        for idx in range(export_disks): 
4844          option = 'disk%d_dump' % idx 
4845          if export_info.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, option): 
4846            # FIXME: are the old os-es, disk sizes, etc. useful? 
4847            export_name = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, option) 
4848            image = os.path.join(src_path, export_name) 
4849            disk_images.append(image) 
4850          else: 
4851            disk_images.append(False) 
4852   
4853        self.src_images = disk_images 
4854   
4855        old_name = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, 'name') 
4856        # FIXME: int() here could throw a ValueError on broken exports 
4857        exp_nic_count = int(export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, 'nic_count')) 
4858        if self.op.instance_name == old_name: 
4859          for idx, nic in enumerate(self.nics): 
4860            if nic.mac == constants.VALUE_AUTO and exp_nic_count >= idx: 
4861              nic_mac_ini = 'nic%d_mac' % idx 
4862              nic.mac = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, nic_mac_ini) 
4863   
4864      # ENDIF: self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT 
4865      # ip ping checks (we use the same ip that was resolved in ExpandNames) 
4866      if self.op.start and not self.op.ip_check: 
4867        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot ignore IP address conflicts when" 
4868                                   " adding an instance in start mode") 
4869   
4870      if self.op.ip_check: 
4871        if utils.TcpPing(self.check_ip, constants.DEFAULT_NODED_PORT): 
4872          raise errors.OpPrereqError("IP %s of instance %s already in use" % 
4873                                     (self.check_ip, self.op.instance_name)) 
4874   
4875      #### mac address generation 
4876      # By generating here the mac address both the allocator and the hooks get 
4877      # the real final mac address rather than the 'auto' or 'generate' value. 
4878      # There is a race condition between the generation and the instance object 
4879      # creation, which means that we know the mac is valid now, but we're not 
4880      # sure it will be when we actually add the instance. If things go bad 
4881      # adding the instance will abort because of a duplicate mac, and the 
4882      # creation job will fail. 
4883      for nic in self.nics: 
4884        if nic.mac in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
4885          nic.mac = self.cfg.GenerateMAC() 
4886   
4887      #### allocator run 
4888   
4889      if self.op.iallocator is not None: 
4890        self._RunAllocator() 
4891   
4892      #### node related checks 
4893   
4894      # check primary node 
4895      self.pnode = pnode = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.op.pnode) 
4896      assert self.pnode is not None, \ 
4897        "Cannot retrieve locked node %s" % self.op.pnode 
4898      if pnode.offline: 
4899        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot use offline primary node '%s'" % 
4900                                   pnode.name) 
4901      if pnode.drained: 
4902        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot use drained primary node '%s'" % 
4903                                   pnode.name) 
4904   
4905      self.secondaries = [] 
4906   
4907      # mirror node verification 
4908      if self.op.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
4909        if self.op.snode is None: 
4910          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The networked disk templates need" 
4911                                     " a mirror node") 
4912        if self.op.snode == pnode.name: 
4913          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The secondary node cannot be" 
4914                                     " the primary node.") 
4915        _CheckNodeOnline(self, self.op.snode) 
4916        _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, self.op.snode) 
4917        self.secondaries.append(self.op.snode) 
4918   
4919      nodenames = [pnode.name] + self.secondaries 
4920   
4921      req_size = _ComputeDiskSize(self.op.disk_template, 
4922                                  self.disks) 
4923   
4924      # Check lv size requirements 
4925      if req_size is not None: 
4926        nodeinfo = self.rpc.call_node_info(nodenames, self.cfg.GetVGName(), 
4927                                           self.op.hypervisor) 
4928        for node in nodenames: 
4929          info = nodeinfo[node] 
4930          info.Raise() 
4931          info = info.data 
4932          if not info: 
4933            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot get current information" 
4934                                       " from node '%s'" % node) 
4935          vg_free = info.get('vg_free', None) 
4936          if not isinstance(vg_free, int): 
4937            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute free disk space on" 
4938                                       " node %s" % node) 
4939          if req_size > info['vg_free']: 
4940            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Not enough disk space on target node %s." 
4941                                       " %d MB available, %d MB required" % 
4942                                       (node, info['vg_free'], req_size)) 
4943   
4944      _CheckHVParams(self, nodenames, self.op.hypervisor, self.op.hvparams) 
4945   
4946      # os verification 
4947      result = self.rpc.call_os_get(pnode.name, self.op.os_type) 
4948      result.Raise() 
4949      if not isinstance(result.data, objects.OS) or not result.data: 
4950        raise errors.OpPrereqError("OS '%s' not in supported os list for" 
4951                                   " primary node"  % self.op.os_type) 
4952   
4953      # bridge check on primary node 
4954      bridges = [n.bridge for n in self.nics] 
4955      result = self.rpc.call_bridges_exist(self.pnode.name, bridges) 
4956      result.Raise() 
4957      if not result.data: 
4958        raise errors.OpPrereqError("One of the target bridges '%s' does not" 
4959                                   " exist on destination node '%s'" % 
4960                                   (",".join(bridges), pnode.name)) 
4961   
4962      # memory check on primary node 
4963      if self.op.start: 
4964        _CheckNodeFreeMemory(self, self.pnode.name, 
4965                             "creating instance %s" % self.op.instance_name, 
4966                             self.be_full[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
4967                             self.op.hypervisor) 

4968   

4969 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

4970      """Create and add the instance to the cluster. 
4971   
4972      """ 
4973      instance = self.op.instance_name 
4974      pnode_name = self.pnode.name 
4975   
4976      ht_kind = self.op.hypervisor 
4977      if ht_kind in constants.HTS_REQ_PORT: 
4978        network_port = self.cfg.AllocatePort() 
4979      else: 
4980        network_port = None 
4981   
4982      ##if self.op.vnc_bind_address is None: 
4983      ##  self.op.vnc_bind_address = constants.VNC_DEFAULT_BIND_ADDRESS 
4984   
4985      # this is needed because os.path.join does not accept None arguments 
4986      if self.op.file_storage_dir is None: 
4987        string_file_storage_dir = "" 
4988      else: 
4989        string_file_storage_dir = self.op.file_storage_dir 
4990   
4991      # build the full file storage dir path 
4992      file_storage_dir = os.path.normpath(os.path.join( 
4993                                          self.cfg.GetFileStorageDir(), 
4994                                          string_file_storage_dir, instance)) 
4995   
4996   
4997      disks = _GenerateDiskTemplate(self, 
4998                                    self.op.disk_template, 
4999                                    instance, pnode_name, 
5000                                    self.secondaries, 
5001                                    self.disks, 
5002                                    file_storage_dir, 
5003                                    self.op.file_driver, 
5004                                    0) 
5005   
5006      iobj = objects.Instance(name=instance, os=self.op.os_type, 
5007                              primary_node=pnode_name, 
5008                              nics=self.nics, disks=disks, 
5009                              disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
5010                              admin_up=False, 
5011                              network_port=network_port, 
5012                              beparams=self.op.beparams, 
5013                              hvparams=self.op.hvparams, 
5014                              hypervisor=self.op.hypervisor, 
5015                              ) 
5016   
5017      feedback_fn("* creating instance disks...") 
5018      try: 
5019        _CreateDisks(self, iobj) 
5020      except errors.OpExecError: 
5021        self.LogWarning("Device creation failed, reverting...") 
5022        try: 
5023          _RemoveDisks(self, iobj) 
5024        finally: 
5025          self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(instance) 
5026          raise 
5027   
5028      feedback_fn("adding instance %s to cluster config" % instance) 
5029   
5030      self.cfg.AddInstance(iobj) 
5031      # Declare that we don't want to remove the instance lock anymore, as we've 
5032      # added the instance to the config 
5033      del self.remove_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] 
5034      # Unlock all the nodes 
5035      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
5036        nodes_keep = [self.op.src_node] 
5037        nodes_release = [node for node in self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
5038                         if node != self.op.src_node] 
5039        self.context.glm.release(locking.LEVEL_NODE, nodes_release) 
5040        self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = nodes_keep 
5041      else: 
5042        self.context.glm.release(locking.LEVEL_NODE) 
5043        del self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
5044   
5045      if self.op.wait_for_sync: 
5046        disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, iobj) 
5047      elif iobj.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
5048        # make sure the disks are not degraded (still sync-ing is ok) 
5049        time.sleep(15) 
5050        feedback_fn("* checking mirrors status") 
5051        disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, iobj, oneshot=True) 
5052      else: 
5053        disk_abort = False 
5054   
5055      if disk_abort: 
5056        _RemoveDisks(self, iobj) 
5057        self.cfg.RemoveInstance(iobj.name) 
5058        # Make sure the instance lock gets removed 
5059        self.remove_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = iobj.name 
5060        raise errors.OpExecError("There are some degraded disks for" 
5061                                 " this instance") 
5062   
5063      feedback_fn("creating os for instance %s on node %s" % 
5064                  (instance, pnode_name)) 
5065   
5066      if iobj.disk_template != constants.DT_DISKLESS: 
5067        if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_CREATE: 
5068          feedback_fn("* running the instance OS create scripts...") 
5069          result = self.rpc.call_instance_os_add(pnode_name, iobj) 
5070          msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5071          if msg: 
5072            raise errors.OpExecError("Could not add os for instance %s" 
5073                                     " on node %s: %s" % 
5074                                     (instance, pnode_name, msg)) 
5075   
5076        elif self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
5077          feedback_fn("* running the instance OS import scripts...") 
5078          src_node = self.op.src_node 
5079          src_images = self.src_images 
5080          cluster_name = self.cfg.GetClusterName() 
5081          import_result = self.rpc.call_instance_os_import(pnode_name, iobj, 
5082                                                           src_node, src_images, 
5083                                                           cluster_name) 
5084          import_result.Raise() 
5085          for idx, result in enumerate(import_result.data): 
5086            if not result: 
5087              self.LogWarning("Could not import the image %s for instance" 
5088                              " %s, disk %d, on node %s" % 
5089                              (src_images[idx], instance, idx, pnode_name)) 
5090        else: 
5091          # also checked in the prereq part 
5092          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown OS initialization mode '%s'" 
5093                                       % self.op.mode) 
5094   
5095      if self.op.start: 
5096        iobj.admin_up = True 
5097        self.cfg.Update(iobj) 
5098        logging.info("Starting instance %s on node %s", instance, pnode_name) 
5099        feedback_fn("* starting instance...") 
5100        result = self.rpc.call_instance_start(pnode_name, iobj, None, None) 
5101        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5102        if msg: 
5103          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not start instance: %s" % msg)

5131 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

5132      """Connect to the console of an instance 
5133   
5134      """ 
5135      instance = self.instance 
5136      node = instance.primary_node 
5137   
5138      node_insts = self.rpc.call_instance_list([node], 
5139                                               [instance.hypervisor])[node] 
5140      node_insts.Raise() 
5141   
5142      if instance.name not in node_insts.data: 
5143        raise errors.OpExecError("Instance %s is not running." % instance.name) 
5144

5146

5148      cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
5149      # beparams and hvparams are passed separately, to avoid editing the 
5150      # instance and then saving the defaults in the instance itself. 
5151      hvparams = cluster.FillHV(instance) 
5152      beparams = cluster.FillBE(instance) 
5153      console_cmd = hyper.GetShellCommandForConsole(instance, hvparams, beparams) 
5154

5156      return self.ssh.BuildCmd(node, "root", console_cmd, batch=True, tty=True)

5159 -class LUReplaceDisks(LogicalUnit): 

5160    """Replace the disks of an instance. 
5161   
5162    """

5164    HTYPE = constants.HTYPE_INSTANCE 
5165    _OP_REQP = ["instance_name", "mode", "disks"]

5168 -  def CheckArguments(self): 

5169      if not hasattr(self.op, "remote_node"): 
5170        self.op.remote_node = None 
5171      if not hasattr(self.op, "iallocator"): 
5172        self.op.iallocator = None 
5173   
5174      # check for valid parameter combination 
5175      cnt = [self.op.remote_node, self.op.iallocator].count(None) 
5176      if self.op.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG: 
5177        if cnt == 2: 
5178          raise errors.OpPrereqError("When changing the secondary either an" 
5179                                     " iallocator script must be used or the" 
5180                                     " new node given") 
5181        elif cnt == 0: 
5182          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Give either the iallocator or the new" 
5183                                     " secondary, not both") 
5184      else: # not replacing the secondary 
5185        if cnt != 2: 
5186          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The iallocator and new node options can" 
5187                                     " be used only when changing the" 
5188                                     " secondary node")

5190 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

5191      self._ExpandAndLockInstance() 
5192   
5193      if self.op.iallocator is not None: 
5194        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET 
5195      elif self.op.remote_node is not None: 
5196        remote_node = self.cfg.ExpandNodeName(self.op.remote_node) 
5197        if remote_node is None: 
5198          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Node '%s' not known" % 
5199                                     self.op.remote_node) 
5200        self.op.remote_node = remote_node 
5201        # Warning: do not remove the locking of the new secondary here 
5202        # unless DRBD8.AddChildren is changed to work in parallel; 
5203        # currently it doesn't since parallel invocations of 
5204        # FindUnusedMinor will conflict 
5205        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = [remote_node] 
5206        self.recalculate_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = constants.LOCKS_APPEND 
5207      else: 
5208        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = [] 
5209        self.recalculate_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = constants.LOCKS_REPLACE

5211 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

5212      # If we're not already locking all nodes in the set we have to declare the 
5213      # instance's primary/secondary nodes. 
5214      if (level == locking.LEVEL_NODE and 
5215          self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] is not locking.ALL_SET): 
5216        self._LockInstancesNodes()

5218 -  def _RunAllocator(self): 

5219      """Compute a new secondary node using an IAllocator. 
5220   
5221      """ 
5222      ial = IAllocator(self, 
5223                       mode=constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC, 
5224                       name=self.op.instance_name, 
5225                       relocate_from=[self.sec_node]) 
5226   
5227      ial.Run(self.op.iallocator) 
5228   
5229      if not ial.success: 
5230        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute nodes using" 
5231                                   " iallocator '%s': %s" % (self.op.iallocator, 
5232                                                             ial.info)) 
5233      if len(ial.nodes) != ial.required_nodes: 
5234        raise errors.OpPrereqError("iallocator '%s' returned invalid number" 
5235                                   " of nodes (%s), required %s" % 
5236                                   (self.op.iallocator, 
5237                                    len(ial.nodes), ial.required_nodes)) 
5238      self.op.remote_node = ial.nodes[0] 
5239      self.LogInfo("Selected new secondary for the instance: %s", 
5240                   self.op.remote_node)

5242 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

5243      """Build hooks env. 
5244   
5245      This runs on the master, the primary and all the secondaries. 
5246   
5247      """ 
5248      env = { 
5249        "MODE": self.op.mode, 
5250        "NEW_SECONDARY": self.op.remote_node, 
5251        "OLD_SECONDARY": self.instance.secondary_nodes[0], 
5252        } 
5253      env.update(_BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, self.instance)) 
5254      nl = [ 
5255        self.cfg.GetMasterNode(), 
5256        self.instance.primary_node, 
5257        ] 
5258      if self.op.remote_node is not None: 
5259        nl.append(self.op.remote_node) 
5260      return env, nl, nl

5262 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

5263      """Check prerequisites. 
5264   
5265      This checks that the instance is in the cluster. 
5266   
5267      """ 
5268      instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.op.instance_name) 
5269      assert instance is not None, \ 
5270        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
5271      self.instance = instance 
5272   
5273      if instance.disk_template != constants.DT_DRBD8: 
5274        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can only run replace disks for DRBD8-based" 
5275                                   " instances") 
5276   
5277      if len(instance.secondary_nodes) != 1: 
5278        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The instance has a strange layout," 
5279                                   " expected one secondary but found %d" % 
5280                                   len(instance.secondary_nodes)) 
5281   
5282      self.sec_node = instance.secondary_nodes[0] 
5283   
5284      if self.op.iallocator is not None: 
5285        self._RunAllocator() 
5286   
5287      remote_node = self.op.remote_node 
5288      if remote_node is not None: 
5289        self.remote_node_info = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(remote_node) 
5290        assert self.remote_node_info is not None, \ 
5291          "Cannot retrieve locked node %s" % remote_node 
5292      else: 
5293        self.remote_node_info = None 
5294      if remote_node == instance.primary_node: 
5295        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The specified node is the primary node of" 
5296                                   " the instance.") 
5297      elif remote_node == self.sec_node: 
5298        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The specified node is already the" 
5299                                   " secondary node of the instance.") 
5300   
5301      if self.op.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_PRI: 
5302        n1 = self.tgt_node = instance.primary_node 
5303        n2 = self.oth_node = self.sec_node 
5304      elif self.op.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_SEC: 
5305        n1 = self.tgt_node = self.sec_node 
5306        n2 = self.oth_node = instance.primary_node 
5307      elif self.op.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG: 
5308        n1 = self.new_node = remote_node 
5309        n2 = self.oth_node = instance.primary_node 
5310        self.tgt_node = self.sec_node 
5311        _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, remote_node) 
5312      else: 
5313        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unhandled disk replace mode") 
5314   
5315      _CheckNodeOnline(self, n1) 
5316      _CheckNodeOnline(self, n2) 
5317   
5318      if not self.op.disks: 
5319        self.op.disks = range(len(instance.disks)) 
5320   
5321      for disk_idx in self.op.disks: 
5322        instance.FindDisk(disk_idx) 

5323   

5324 -  def _ExecD8DiskOnly(self, feedback_fn): 

5325      """Replace a disk on the primary or secondary for dbrd8. 
5326   
5327      The algorithm for replace is quite complicated: 
5328   
5329        1. for each disk to be replaced: 
5330   
5331          1. create new LVs on the target node with unique names 
5332          1. detach old LVs from the drbd device 
5333          1. rename old LVs to name_replaced.<time_t> 
5334          1. rename new LVs to old LVs 
5335          1. attach the new LVs (with the old names now) to the drbd device 
5336   
5337        1. wait for sync across all devices 
5338   
5339        1. for each modified disk: 
5340   
5341          1. remove old LVs (which have the name name_replaces.<time_t>) 
5342   
5343      Failures are not very well handled. 
5344   
5345      """ 
5346      steps_total = 6 
5347      warning, info = (self.proc.LogWarning, self.proc.LogInfo) 
5348      instance = self.instance 
5349      iv_names = {} 
5350      vgname = self.cfg.GetVGName() 
5351      # start of work 
5352      cfg = self.cfg 
5353      tgt_node = self.tgt_node 
5354      oth_node = self.oth_node 
5355   
5356      # Step: check device activation 
5357      self.proc.LogStep(1, steps_total, "check device existence") 
5358      info("checking volume groups") 
5359      my_vg = cfg.GetVGName() 
5360      results = self.rpc.call_vg_list([oth_node, tgt_node]) 
5361      if not results: 
5362        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't list volume groups on the nodes") 
5363      for node in oth_node, tgt_node: 
5364        res = results[node] 
5365        if res.failed or not res.data or my_vg not in res.data: 
5366          raise errors.OpExecError("Volume group '%s' not found on %s" % 
5367                                   (my_vg, node)) 
5368      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5369        if idx not in self.op.disks: 
5370          continue 
5371        for node in tgt_node, oth_node: 
5372          info("checking disk/%d on %s" % (idx, node)) 
5373          cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node) 
5374          result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(node, dev) 
5375          msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5376          if not msg and not result.payload: 
5377            msg = "disk not found" 
5378          if msg: 
5379            raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find disk/%d on node %s: %s" % 
5380                                     (idx, node, msg)) 
5381   
5382      # Step: check other node consistency 
5383      self.proc.LogStep(2, steps_total, "check peer consistency") 
5384      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5385        if idx not in self.op.disks: 
5386          continue 
5387        info("checking disk/%d consistency on %s" % (idx, oth_node)) 
5388        if not _CheckDiskConsistency(self, dev, oth_node, 
5389                                     oth_node==instance.primary_node): 
5390          raise errors.OpExecError("Peer node (%s) has degraded storage, unsafe" 
5391                                   " to replace disks on this node (%s)" % 
5392                                   (oth_node, tgt_node)) 
5393   
5394      # Step: create new storage 
5395      self.proc.LogStep(3, steps_total, "allocate new storage") 
5396      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5397        if idx not in self.op.disks: 
5398          continue 
5399        size = dev.size 
5400        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, tgt_node) 
5401        lv_names = [".disk%d_%s" % (idx, suf) 
5402                    for suf in ["data", "meta"]] 
5403        names = _GenerateUniqueNames(self, lv_names) 
5404        lv_data = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=size, 
5405                               logical_id=(vgname, names[0])) 
5406        lv_meta = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=128, 
5407                               logical_id=(vgname, names[1])) 
5408        new_lvs = [lv_data, lv_meta] 
5409        old_lvs = dev.children 
5410        iv_names[dev.iv_name] = (dev, old_lvs, new_lvs) 
5411        info("creating new local storage on %s for %s" % 
5412             (tgt_node, dev.iv_name)) 
5413        # we pass force_create=True to force the LVM creation 
5414        for new_lv in new_lvs: 
5415          _CreateBlockDev(self, tgt_node, instance, new_lv, True, 
5416                          _GetInstanceInfoText(instance), False) 
5417   
5418      # Step: for each lv, detach+rename*2+attach 
5419      self.proc.LogStep(4, steps_total, "change drbd configuration") 
5420      for dev, old_lvs, new_lvs in iv_names.itervalues(): 
5421        info("detaching %s drbd from local storage" % dev.iv_name) 
5422        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_removechildren(tgt_node, dev, old_lvs) 
5423        result.Raise() 
5424        if not result.data: 
5425          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't detach drbd from local storage on node" 
5426                                   " %s for device %s" % (tgt_node, dev.iv_name)) 
5427        #dev.children = [] 
5428        #cfg.Update(instance) 
5429   
5430        # ok, we created the new LVs, so now we know we have the needed 
5431        # storage; as such, we proceed on the target node to rename 
5432        # old_lv to _old, and new_lv to old_lv; note that we rename LVs 
5433        # using the assumption that logical_id == physical_id (which in 
5434        # turn is the unique_id on that node) 
5435   
5436        # FIXME(iustin): use a better name for the replaced LVs 
5437        temp_suffix = int(time.time()) 
5438        ren_fn = lambda d, suff: (d.physical_id[0], 
5439                                  d.physical_id[1] + "_replaced-%s" % suff) 
5440        # build the rename list based on what LVs exist on the node 
5441        rlist = [] 
5442        for to_ren in old_lvs: 
5443          result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(tgt_node, to_ren) 
5444          if not result.RemoteFailMsg() and result.payload: 
5445            # device exists 
5446            rlist.append((to_ren, ren_fn(to_ren, temp_suffix))) 
5447   
5448        info("renaming the old LVs on the target node") 
5449        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(tgt_node, rlist) 
5450        result.Raise() 
5451        if not result.data: 
5452          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't rename old LVs on node %s" % tgt_node) 
5453        # now we rename the new LVs to the old LVs 
5454        info("renaming the new LVs on the target node") 
5455        rlist = [(new, old.physical_id) for old, new in zip(old_lvs, new_lvs)] 
5456        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(tgt_node, rlist) 
5457        result.Raise() 
5458        if not result.data: 
5459          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't rename new LVs on node %s" % tgt_node) 
5460   
5461        for old, new in zip(old_lvs, new_lvs): 
5462          new.logical_id = old.logical_id 
5463          cfg.SetDiskID(new, tgt_node) 
5464   
5465        for disk in old_lvs: 
5466          disk.logical_id = ren_fn(disk, temp_suffix) 
5467          cfg.SetDiskID(disk, tgt_node) 
5468   
5469        # now that the new lvs have the old name, we can add them to the device 
5470        info("adding new mirror component on %s" % tgt_node) 
5471        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_addchildren(tgt_node, dev, new_lvs) 
5472        if result.failed or not result.data: 
5473          for new_lv in new_lvs: 
5474            msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(tgt_node, new_lv).RemoteFailMsg() 
5475            if msg: 
5476              warning("Can't rollback device %s: %s", dev, msg, 
5477                      hint="cleanup manually the unused logical volumes") 
5478          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't add local storage to drbd") 
5479   
5480        dev.children = new_lvs 
5481        cfg.Update(instance) 
5482   
5483      # Step: wait for sync 
5484   
5485      # this can fail as the old devices are degraded and _WaitForSync 
5486      # does a combined result over all disks, so we don't check its 
5487      # return value 
5488      self.proc.LogStep(5, steps_total, "sync devices") 
5489      _WaitForSync(self, instance, unlock=True) 
5490   
5491      # so check manually all the devices 
5492      for name, (dev, old_lvs, new_lvs) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
5493        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, instance.primary_node) 
5494        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(instance.primary_node, dev) 
5495        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5496        if not msg and not result.payload: 
5497          msg = "disk not found" 
5498        if msg: 
5499          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find DRBD device %s: %s" % 
5500                                   (name, msg)) 
5501        if result.payload[5]: 
5502          raise errors.OpExecError("DRBD device %s is degraded!" % name) 
5503   
5504      # Step: remove old storage 
5505      self.proc.LogStep(6, steps_total, "removing old storage") 
5506      for name, (dev, old_lvs, new_lvs) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
5507        info("remove logical volumes for %s" % name) 
5508        for lv in old_lvs: 
5509          cfg.SetDiskID(lv, tgt_node) 
5510          msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(tgt_node, lv).RemoteFailMsg() 
5511          if msg: 
5512            warning("Can't remove old LV: %s" % msg, 
5513                    hint="manually remove unused LVs") 
5514            continue 

5515   

5516 -  def _ExecD8Secondary(self, feedback_fn): 

5517      """Replace the secondary node for drbd8. 
5518   
5519      The algorithm for replace is quite complicated: 
5520        - for all disks of the instance: 
5521          - create new LVs on the new node with same names 
5522          - shutdown the drbd device on the old secondary 
5523          - disconnect the drbd network on the primary 
5524          - create the drbd device on the new secondary 
5525          - network attach the drbd on the primary, using an artifice: 
5526            the drbd code for Attach() will connect to the network if it 
5527            finds a device which is connected to the good local disks but 
5528            not network enabled 
5529        - wait for sync across all devices 
5530        - remove all disks from the old secondary 
5531   
5532      Failures are not very well handled. 
5533   
5534      """ 
5535      steps_total = 6 
5536      warning, info = (self.proc.LogWarning, self.proc.LogInfo) 
5537      instance = self.instance 
5538      iv_names = {} 
5539      # start of work 
5540      cfg = self.cfg 
5541      old_node = self.tgt_node 
5542      new_node = self.new_node 
5543      pri_node = instance.primary_node 
5544      nodes_ip = { 
5545        old_node: self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(old_node).secondary_ip, 
5546        new_node: self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(new_node).secondary_ip, 
5547        pri_node: self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(pri_node).secondary_ip, 
5548        } 
5549   
5550      # Step: check device activation 
5551      self.proc.LogStep(1, steps_total, "check device existence") 
5552      info("checking volume groups") 
5553      my_vg = cfg.GetVGName() 
5554      results = self.rpc.call_vg_list([pri_node, new_node]) 
5555      for node in pri_node, new_node: 
5556        res = results[node] 
5557        if res.failed or not res.data or my_vg not in res.data: 
5558          raise errors.OpExecError("Volume group '%s' not found on %s" % 
5559                                   (my_vg, node)) 
5560      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5561        if idx not in self.op.disks: 
5562          continue 
5563        info("checking disk/%d on %s" % (idx, pri_node)) 
5564        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, pri_node) 
5565        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(pri_node, dev) 
5566        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5567        if not msg and not result.payload: 
5568          msg = "disk not found" 
5569        if msg: 
5570          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find disk/%d on node %s: %s" % 
5571                                   (idx, pri_node, msg)) 
5572   
5573      # Step: check other node consistency 
5574      self.proc.LogStep(2, steps_total, "check peer consistency") 
5575      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5576        if idx not in self.op.disks: 
5577          continue 
5578        info("checking disk/%d consistency on %s" % (idx, pri_node)) 
5579        if not _CheckDiskConsistency(self, dev, pri_node, True, ldisk=True): 
5580          raise errors.OpExecError("Primary node (%s) has degraded storage," 
5581                                   " unsafe to replace the secondary" % 
5582                                   pri_node) 
5583   
5584      # Step: create new storage 
5585      self.proc.LogStep(3, steps_total, "allocate new storage") 
5586      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5587        info("adding new local storage on %s for disk/%d" % 
5588             (new_node, idx)) 
5589        # we pass force_create=True to force LVM creation 
5590        for new_lv in dev.children: 
5591          _CreateBlockDev(self, new_node, instance, new_lv, True, 
5592                          _GetInstanceInfoText(instance), False) 
5593   
5594      # Step 4: dbrd minors and drbd setups changes 
5595      # after this, we must manually remove the drbd minors on both the 
5596      # error and the success paths 
5597      minors = cfg.AllocateDRBDMinor([new_node for dev in instance.disks], 
5598                                     instance.name) 
5599      logging.debug("Allocated minors %s" % (minors,)) 
5600      self.proc.LogStep(4, steps_total, "changing drbd configuration") 
5601      for idx, (dev, new_minor) in enumerate(zip(instance.disks, minors)): 
5602        info("activating a new drbd on %s for disk/%d" % (new_node, idx)) 
5603        # create new devices on new_node; note that we create two IDs: 
5604        # one without port, so the drbd will be activated without 
5605        # networking information on the new node at this stage, and one 
5606        # with network, for the latter activation in step 4 
5607        (o_node1, o_node2, o_port, o_minor1, o_minor2, o_secret) = dev.logical_id 
5608        if pri_node == o_node1: 
5609          p_minor = o_minor1 
5610        else: 
5611          p_minor = o_minor2 
5612   
5613        new_alone_id = (pri_node, new_node, None, p_minor, new_minor, o_secret) 
5614        new_net_id = (pri_node, new_node, o_port, p_minor, new_minor, o_secret) 
5615   
5616        iv_names[idx] = (dev, dev.children, new_net_id) 
5617        logging.debug("Allocated new_minor: %s, new_logical_id: %s", new_minor, 
5618                      new_net_id) 
5619        new_drbd = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_DRBD8, 
5620                                logical_id=new_alone_id, 
5621                                children=dev.children, 
5622                                size=dev.size) 
5623        try: 
5624          _CreateSingleBlockDev(self, new_node, instance, new_drbd, 
5625                                _GetInstanceInfoText(instance), False) 
5626        except errors.GenericError: 
5627          self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(instance.name) 
5628          raise 
5629   
5630      for idx, dev in enumerate(instance.disks): 
5631        # we have new devices, shutdown the drbd on the old secondary 
5632        info("shutting down drbd for disk/%d on old node" % idx) 
5633        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, old_node) 
5634        msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_shutdown(old_node, dev).RemoteFailMsg() 
5635        if msg: 
5636          warning("Failed to shutdown drbd for disk/%d on old node: %s" % 
5637                  (idx, msg), 
5638                  hint="Please cleanup this device manually as soon as possible") 
5639   
5640      info("detaching primary drbds from the network (=> standalone)") 
5641      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_disconnect_net([pri_node], nodes_ip, 
5642                                                 instance.disks)[pri_node] 
5643   
5644      msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5645      if msg: 
5646        # detaches didn't succeed (unlikely) 
5647        self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(instance.name) 
5648        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't detach the disks from the network on" 
5649                                 " old node: %s" % (msg,)) 
5650   
5651      # if we managed to detach at least one, we update all the disks of 
5652      # the instance to point to the new secondary 
5653      info("updating instance configuration") 
5654      for dev, _, new_logical_id in iv_names.itervalues(): 
5655        dev.logical_id = new_logical_id 
5656        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, pri_node) 
5657      cfg.Update(instance) 
5658   
5659      # and now perform the drbd attach 
5660      info("attaching primary drbds to new secondary (standalone => connected)") 
5661      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_attach_net([pri_node, new_node], nodes_ip, 
5662                                             instance.disks, instance.name, 
5663                                             False) 
5664      for to_node, to_result in result.items(): 
5665        msg = to_result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5666        if msg: 
5667          warning("can't attach drbd disks on node %s: %s", to_node, msg, 
5668                  hint="please do a gnt-instance info to see the" 
5669                  " status of disks") 
5670   
5671      # this can fail as the old devices are degraded and _WaitForSync 
5672      # does a combined result over all disks, so we don't check its 
5673      # return value 
5674      self.proc.LogStep(5, steps_total, "sync devices") 
5675      _WaitForSync(self, instance, unlock=True) 
5676   
5677      # so check manually all the devices 
5678      for idx, (dev, old_lvs, _) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
5679        cfg.SetDiskID(dev, pri_node) 
5680        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(pri_node, dev) 
5681        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5682        if not msg and not result.payload: 
5683          msg = "disk not found" 
5684        if msg: 
5685          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find DRBD device disk/%d: %s" % 
5686                                   (idx, msg)) 
5687        if result.payload[5]: 
5688          raise errors.OpExecError("DRBD device disk/%d is degraded!" % idx) 
5689   
5690      self.proc.LogStep(6, steps_total, "removing old storage") 
5691      for idx, (dev, old_lvs, _) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
5692        info("remove logical volumes for disk/%d" % idx) 
5693        for lv in old_lvs: 
5694          cfg.SetDiskID(lv, old_node) 
5695          msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(old_node, lv).RemoteFailMsg() 
5696          if msg: 
5697            warning("Can't remove LV on old secondary: %s", msg, 
5698                    hint="Cleanup stale volumes by hand") 

5699   

5700 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

5701      """Execute disk replacement. 
5702   
5703      This dispatches the disk replacement to the appropriate handler. 
5704   
5705      """ 
5706      instance = self.instance 
5707   
5708      # Activate the instance disks if we're replacing them on a down instance 
5709      if not instance.admin_up: 
5710        _StartInstanceDisks(self, instance, True) 
5711   
5712      if self.op.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG: 
5713        fn = self._ExecD8Secondary 
5714      else: 
5715        fn = self._ExecD8DiskOnly 
5716   
5717      ret = fn(feedback_fn) 
5718   
5719      # Deactivate the instance disks if we're replacing them on a down instance 
5720      if not instance.admin_up: 
5721        _SafeShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
5722   
5723      return ret

5761 -  def CheckPrereq(self):

5763   
5764      This checks that the instance is in the cluster. 
5765   
5766      """

5768      assert instance is not None, \ 
5769        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
5770      nodenames = list(instance.all_nodes) 
5771      for node in nodenames: 
5772        _CheckNodeOnline(self, node) 
5773   
5774   
5775      self.instance = instance 
5776   
5777      if instance.disk_template not in (constants.DT_PLAIN, constants.DT_DRBD8): 
5778        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance's disk layout does not support" 
5779                                   " growing.") 
5780   
5781      self.disk = instance.FindDisk(self.op.disk) 
5782

5784                                         instance.hypervisor) 
5785      for node in nodenames: 
5786        info = nodeinfo[node] 
5787        if info.failed or not info.data: 
5788          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot get current information" 
5789                                     " from node '%s'" % node) 
5790        vg_free = info.data.get('vg_free', None) 
5791        if not isinstance(vg_free, int): 
5792          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute free disk space on" 
5793                                     " node %s" % node) 
5794        if self.op.amount > vg_free: 
5795          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Not enough disk space on target node %s:" 
5796                                     " %d MiB available, %d MiB required" % 
5797                                     (node, vg_free, self.op.amount))

5799 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

5800      """Execute disk grow. 
5801   
5802      """ 
5803      instance = self.instance 
5804      disk = self.disk 
5805      for node in instance.all_nodes: 
5806        self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, node) 
5807        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_grow(node, disk, self.op.amount) 
5808        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
5809        if msg: 
5810          raise errors.OpExecError("Grow request failed to node %s: %s" % 
5811                                   (node, msg)) 
5812      disk.RecordGrow(self.op.amount) 
5813      self.cfg.Update(instance) 
5814      if self.op.wait_for_sync: 
5815        disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, instance) 
5816        if disk_abort: 
5817          self.proc.LogWarning("Warning: disk sync-ing has not returned a good" 
5818                               " status.\nPlease check the instance.")

5833        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid argument type 'instances'") 
5834

5836        self.wanted_names = [] 
5837        for name in self.op.instances: 
5838          full_name = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(name) 
5839          if full_name is None: 
5840            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' not known" % name)

5842        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = self.wanted_names

5867 -  def _ComputeDiskStatus(self, instance, snode, dev): 

5868      """Compute block device status. 
5869   
5870      """ 
5871      static = self.op.static 
5872      if not static: 
5873        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, instance.primary_node) 
5874        dev_pstatus = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(instance.primary_node, dev) 
5875        if dev_pstatus.offline: 
5876          dev_pstatus = None 
5877        else: 
5878          msg = dev_pstatus.RemoteFailMsg() 
5879          if msg: 
5880            raise errors.OpExecError("Can't compute disk status for %s: %s" % 
5881                                     (instance.name, msg)) 
5882          dev_pstatus = dev_pstatus.payload 
5883      else: 
5884        dev_pstatus = None 
5885   
5886      if dev.dev_type in constants.LDS_DRBD: 
5887        # we change the snode then (otherwise we use the one passed in) 
5888        if dev.logical_id[0] == instance.primary_node: 
5889          snode = dev.logical_id[1] 
5890        else: 
5891          snode = dev.logical_id[0] 
5892   
5893      if snode and not static: 
5894        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, snode) 
5895        dev_sstatus = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(snode, dev) 
5896        if dev_sstatus.offline: 
5897          dev_sstatus = None 
5898        else: 
5899          msg = dev_sstatus.RemoteFailMsg() 
5900          if msg: 
5901            raise errors.OpExecError("Can't compute disk status for %s: %s" % 
5902                                     (instance.name, msg)) 
5903          dev_sstatus = dev_sstatus.payload 
5904      else: 
5905        dev_sstatus = None 
5906   
5907      if dev.children: 
5908        dev_children = [self._ComputeDiskStatus(instance, snode, child) 
5909                        for child in dev.children] 
5910      else: 
5911        dev_children = [] 
5912   
5913      data = { 
5914        "iv_name": dev.iv_name, 
5915        "dev_type": dev.dev_type, 
5916        "logical_id": dev.logical_id, 
5917        "physical_id": dev.physical_id, 
5918        "pstatus": dev_pstatus, 
5919        "sstatus": dev_sstatus, 
5920        "children": dev_children, 
5921        "mode": dev.mode, 
5922        "size": dev.size, 
5923        } 
5924   
5925      return data

5927 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

5928      """Gather and return data""" 
5929      result = {} 
5930   
5931      cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
5932   
5933      for instance in self.wanted_instances: 
5934        if not self.op.static: 
5935          remote_info = self.rpc.call_instance_info(instance.primary_node, 
5936                                                    instance.name, 
5937                                                    instance.hypervisor) 
5938          remote_info.Raise() 
5939          remote_info = remote_info.data 
5940          if remote_info and "state" in remote_info: 
5941            remote_state = "up" 
5942          else: 
5943            remote_state = "down" 
5944        else: 
5945          remote_state = None 
5946        if instance.admin_up: 
5947          config_state = "up" 
5948        else: 
5949          config_state = "down" 
5950   
5951        disks = [self._ComputeDiskStatus(instance, None, device) 
5952                 for device in instance.disks] 
5953   
5954        idict = { 
5955          "name": instance.name, 
5956          "config_state": config_state, 
5957          "run_state": remote_state, 
5958          "pnode": instance.primary_node, 
5959          "snodes": instance.secondary_nodes, 
5960          "os": instance.os, 
5961          "nics": [(nic.mac, nic.ip, nic.bridge) for nic in instance.nics], 
5962          "disks": disks, 
5963          "hypervisor": instance.hypervisor, 
5964          "network_port": instance.network_port, 
5965          "hv_instance": instance.hvparams, 
5966          "hv_actual": cluster.FillHV(instance), 
5967          "be_instance": instance.beparams, 
5968          "be_actual": cluster.FillBE(instance), 
5969          } 
5970   
5971        result[instance.name] = idict 
5972   
5973      return result

5976 -class LUSetInstanceParams(LogicalUnit): 

5977    """Modifies an instances's parameters. 
5978   
5979    """ 
5980    HPATH = "instance-modify" 
5981    HTYPE = constants.HTYPE_INSTANCE 
5982    _OP_REQP = ["instance_name"]

5985 -  def CheckArguments(self): 

5986      if not hasattr(self.op, 'nics'): 
5987        self.op.nics = [] 
5988      if not hasattr(self.op, 'disks'): 
5989        self.op.disks = [] 
5990      if not hasattr(self.op, 'beparams'): 
5991        self.op.beparams = {} 
5992      if not hasattr(self.op, 'hvparams'): 
5993        self.op.hvparams = {} 
5994      self.op.force = getattr(self.op, "force", False) 
5995      if not (self.op.nics or self.op.disks or 
5996              self.op.hvparams or self.op.beparams): 
5997        raise errors.OpPrereqError("No changes submitted") 
5998   
5999      # Disk validation 
6000      disk_addremove = 0 
6001      for disk_op, disk_dict in self.op.disks: 
6002        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6003          disk_addremove += 1 
6004          continue 
6005        elif disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6006          disk_addremove += 1 
6007        else: 
6008          if not isinstance(disk_op, int): 
6009            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk index") 
6010        if disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6011          mode = disk_dict.setdefault('mode', constants.DISK_RDWR) 
6012          if mode not in constants.DISK_ACCESS_SET: 
6013            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk access mode '%s'" % mode) 
6014          size = disk_dict.get('size', None) 
6015          if size is None: 
6016            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Required disk parameter size missing") 
6017          try: 
6018            size = int(size) 
6019          except (TypeError, ValueError), err: 
6020            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk size parameter: %s" % 
6021                                       str(err)) 
6022          disk_dict['size'] = size 
6023        else: 
6024          # modification of disk 
6025          if 'size' in disk_dict: 
6026            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Disk size change not possible, use" 
6027                                       " grow-disk") 
6028   
6029      if disk_addremove > 1: 
6030        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Only one disk add or remove operation" 
6031                                   " supported at a time") 
6032   
6033      # NIC validation 
6034      nic_addremove = 0 
6035      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
6036        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6037          nic_addremove += 1 
6038          continue 
6039        elif nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6040          nic_addremove += 1 
6041        else: 
6042          if not isinstance(nic_op, int): 
6043            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid nic index") 
6044   
6045        # nic_dict should be a dict 
6046        nic_ip = nic_dict.get('ip', None) 
6047        if nic_ip is not None: 
6048          if nic_ip.lower() == constants.VALUE_NONE: 
6049            nic_dict['ip'] = None 
6050          else: 
6051            if not utils.IsValidIP(nic_ip): 
6052              raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid IP address '%s'" % nic_ip) 
6053   
6054        if nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6055          nic_bridge = nic_dict.get('bridge', None) 
6056          if nic_bridge is None: 
6057            nic_dict['bridge'] = self.cfg.GetDefBridge() 
6058          nic_mac = nic_dict.get('mac', None) 
6059          if nic_mac is None: 
6060            nic_dict['mac'] = constants.VALUE_AUTO 
6061   
6062        if 'mac' in nic_dict: 
6063          nic_mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
6064          if nic_mac not in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
6065            if not utils.IsValidMac(nic_mac): 
6066              raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid MAC address %s" % nic_mac) 
6067          if nic_op != constants.DDM_ADD and nic_mac == constants.VALUE_AUTO: 
6068            raise errors.OpPrereqError("'auto' is not a valid MAC address when" 
6069                                       " modifying an existing nic") 
6070   
6071      if nic_addremove > 1: 
6072        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Only one NIC add or remove operation" 
6073                                   " supported at a time") 

6074   

6075 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

6076      self._ExpandAndLockInstance() 
6077      self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = [] 
6078      self.recalculate_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = constants.LOCKS_REPLACE

6084 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

6085      """Build hooks env. 
6086   
6087      This runs on the master, primary and secondaries. 
6088   
6089      """ 
6090      args = dict() 
6091      if constants.BE_MEMORY in self.be_new: 
6092        args['memory'] = self.be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
6093      if constants.BE_VCPUS in self.be_new: 
6094        args['vcpus'] = self.be_new[constants.BE_VCPUS] 
6095      # TODO: export disk changes. Note: _BuildInstanceHookEnv* don't export disk 
6096      # information at all. 
6097      if self.op.nics: 
6098        args['nics'] = [] 
6099        nic_override = dict(self.op.nics) 
6100        for idx, nic in enumerate(self.instance.nics): 
6101          if idx in nic_override: 
6102            this_nic_override = nic_override[idx] 
6103          else: 
6104            this_nic_override = {} 
6105          if 'ip' in this_nic_override: 
6106            ip = this_nic_override['ip'] 
6107          else: 
6108            ip = nic.ip 
6109          if 'bridge' in this_nic_override: 
6110            bridge = this_nic_override['bridge'] 
6111          else: 
6112            bridge = nic.bridge 
6113          if 'mac' in this_nic_override: 
6114            mac = this_nic_override['mac'] 
6115          else: 
6116            mac = nic.mac 
6117          args['nics'].append((ip, bridge, mac)) 
6118        if constants.DDM_ADD in nic_override: 
6119          ip = nic_override[constants.DDM_ADD].get('ip', None) 
6120          bridge = nic_override[constants.DDM_ADD]['bridge'] 
6121          mac = nic_override[constants.DDM_ADD]['mac'] 
6122          args['nics'].append((ip, bridge, mac)) 
6123        elif constants.DDM_REMOVE in nic_override: 
6124          del args['nics'][-1] 
6125   
6126      env = _BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, self.instance, override=args) 
6127      nl = [self.cfg.GetMasterNode()] + list(self.instance.all_nodes) 
6128      return env, nl, nl
