6130 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

6131      """Check prerequisites. 
6132   
6133      This only checks the instance list against the existing names. 
6134   
6135      """ 
6136      self.force = self.op.force 
6137   
6138      # checking the new params on the primary/secondary nodes 
6139   
6140      instance = self.instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.op.instance_name) 
6141      assert self.instance is not None, \ 
6142        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
6143      pnode = instance.primary_node 
6144      nodelist = list(instance.all_nodes) 
6145   
6146      # hvparams processing 
6147      if self.op.hvparams: 
6148        i_hvdict = copy.deepcopy(instance.hvparams) 
6149        for key, val in self.op.hvparams.iteritems(): 
6150          if val == constants.VALUE_DEFAULT: 
6151            try: 
6152              del i_hvdict[key] 
6153            except KeyError: 
6154              pass 
6155          else: 
6156            i_hvdict[key] = val 
6157        cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
6158        utils.ForceDictType(i_hvdict, constants.HVS_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
6159        hv_new = cluster.FillDict(cluster.hvparams[instance.hypervisor], 
6160                                  i_hvdict) 
6161        # local check 
6162        hypervisor.GetHypervisor( 
6163          instance.hypervisor).CheckParameterSyntax(hv_new) 
6164        _CheckHVParams(self, nodelist, instance.hypervisor, hv_new) 
6165        self.hv_new = hv_new # the new actual values 
6166        self.hv_inst = i_hvdict # the new dict (without defaults) 
6167      else: 
6168        self.hv_new = self.hv_inst = {} 
6169   
6170      # beparams processing 
6171      if self.op.beparams: 
6172        i_bedict = copy.deepcopy(instance.beparams) 
6173        for key, val in self.op.beparams.iteritems(): 
6174          if val == constants.VALUE_DEFAULT: 
6175            try: 
6176              del i_bedict[key] 
6177            except KeyError: 
6178              pass 
6179          else: 
6180            i_bedict[key] = val 
6181        cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
6182        utils.ForceDictType(i_bedict, constants.BES_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
6183        be_new = cluster.FillDict(cluster.beparams[constants.BEGR_DEFAULT], 
6184                                  i_bedict) 
6185        self.be_new = be_new # the new actual values 
6186        self.be_inst = i_bedict # the new dict (without defaults) 
6187      else: 
6188        self.be_new = self.be_inst = {} 
6189   
6190      self.warn = [] 
6191   
6192      if constants.BE_MEMORY in self.op.beparams and not self.force: 
6193        mem_check_list = [pnode] 
6194        if be_new[constants.BE_AUTO_BALANCE]: 
6195          # either we changed auto_balance to yes or it was from before 
6196          mem_check_list.extend(instance.secondary_nodes) 
6197        instance_info = self.rpc.call_instance_info(pnode, instance.name, 
6198                                                    instance.hypervisor) 
6199        nodeinfo = self.rpc.call_node_info(mem_check_list, self.cfg.GetVGName(), 
6200                                           instance.hypervisor) 
6201        if nodeinfo[pnode].failed or not isinstance(nodeinfo[pnode].data, dict): 
6202          # Assume the primary node is unreachable and go ahead 
6203          self.warn.append("Can't get info from primary node %s" % pnode) 
6204        else: 
6205          if not instance_info.failed and instance_info.data: 
6206            current_mem = int(instance_info.data['memory']) 
6207          else: 
6208            # Assume instance not running 
6209            # (there is a slight race condition here, but it's not very probable, 
6210            # and we have no other way to check) 
6211            current_mem = 0 
6212          miss_mem = (be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] - current_mem - 
6213                      nodeinfo[pnode].data['memory_free']) 
6214          if miss_mem > 0: 
6215            raise errors.OpPrereqError("This change will prevent the instance" 
6216                                       " from starting, due to %d MB of memory" 
6217                                       " missing on its primary node" % miss_mem) 
6218   
6219        if be_new[constants.BE_AUTO_BALANCE]: 
6220          for node, nres in nodeinfo.iteritems(): 
6221            if node not in instance.secondary_nodes: 
6222              continue 
6223            if nres.failed or not isinstance(nres.data, dict): 
6224              self.warn.append("Can't get info from secondary node %s" % node) 
6225            elif be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] > nres.data['memory_free']: 
6226              self.warn.append("Not enough memory to failover instance to" 
6227                               " secondary node %s" % node) 
6228   
6229      # NIC processing 
6230      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
6231        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6232          if not instance.nics: 
6233            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has no NICs, cannot remove") 
6234          continue 
6235        if nic_op != constants.DDM_ADD: 
6236          # an existing nic 
6237          if nic_op < 0 or nic_op >= len(instance.nics): 
6238            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid NIC index %s, valid values" 
6239                                       " are 0 to %d" % 
6240                                       (nic_op, len(instance.nics))) 
6241        if 'bridge' in nic_dict: 
6242          nic_bridge = nic_dict['bridge'] 
6243          if nic_bridge is None: 
6244            raise errors.OpPrereqError('Cannot set the nic bridge to None') 
6245          if not self.rpc.call_bridges_exist(pnode, [nic_bridge]): 
6246            msg = ("Bridge '%s' doesn't exist on one of" 
6247                   " the instance nodes" % nic_bridge) 
6248            if self.force: 
6249              self.warn.append(msg) 
6250            else: 
6251              raise errors.OpPrereqError(msg) 
6252        if 'mac' in nic_dict: 
6253          nic_mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
6254          if nic_mac is None: 
6255            raise errors.OpPrereqError('Cannot set the nic mac to None') 
6256          elif nic_mac in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
6257            # otherwise generate the mac 
6258            nic_dict['mac'] = self.cfg.GenerateMAC() 
6259          else: 
6260            # or validate/reserve the current one 
6261            if self.cfg.IsMacInUse(nic_mac): 
6262              raise errors.OpPrereqError("MAC address %s already in use" 
6263                                         " in cluster" % nic_mac) 
6264   
6265      # DISK processing 
6266      if self.op.disks and instance.disk_template == constants.DT_DISKLESS: 
6267        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Disk operations not supported for" 
6268                                   " diskless instances") 
6269      for disk_op, disk_dict in self.op.disks: 
6270        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6271          if len(instance.disks) == 1: 
6272            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot remove the last disk of" 
6273                                       " an instance") 
6274          ins_l = self.rpc.call_instance_list([pnode], [instance.hypervisor]) 
6275          ins_l = ins_l[pnode] 
6276          if ins_l.failed or not isinstance(ins_l.data, list): 
6277            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't contact node '%s'" % pnode) 
6278          if instance.name in ins_l.data: 
6279            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance is running, can't remove" 
6280                                       " disks.") 
6281   
6282        if (disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD and 
6283            len(instance.nics) >= constants.MAX_DISKS): 
6284          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has too many disks (%d), cannot" 
6285                                     " add more" % constants.MAX_DISKS) 
6286        if disk_op not in (constants.DDM_ADD, constants.DDM_REMOVE): 
6287          # an existing disk 
6288          if disk_op < 0 or disk_op >= len(instance.disks): 
6289            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk index %s, valid values" 
6290                                       " are 0 to %d" % 
6291                                       (disk_op, len(instance.disks))) 
6292   
6293      return 

6294   

6295 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6296      """Modifies an instance. 
6297   
6298      All parameters take effect only at the next restart of the instance. 
6299   
6300      """ 
6301      # Process here the warnings from CheckPrereq, as we don't have a 
6302      # feedback_fn there. 
6303      for warn in self.warn: 
6304        feedback_fn("WARNING: %s" % warn) 
6305   
6306      result = [] 
6307      instance = self.instance 
6308      # disk changes 
6309      for disk_op, disk_dict in self.op.disks: 
6310        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6311          # remove the last disk 
6312          device = instance.disks.pop() 
6313          device_idx = len(instance.disks) 
6314          for node, disk in device.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
6315            self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, node) 
6316            msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(node, disk).RemoteFailMsg() 
6317            if msg: 
6318              self.LogWarning("Could not remove disk/%d on node %s: %s," 
6319                              " continuing anyway", device_idx, node, msg) 
6320          result.append(("disk/%d" % device_idx, "remove")) 
6321        elif disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6322          # add a new disk 
6323          if instance.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
6324            file_driver, file_path = instance.disks[0].logical_id 
6325            file_path = os.path.dirname(file_path) 
6326          else: 
6327            file_driver = file_path = None 
6328          disk_idx_base = len(instance.disks) 
6329          new_disk = _GenerateDiskTemplate(self, 
6330                                           instance.disk_template, 
6331                                           instance.name, instance.primary_node, 
6332                                           instance.secondary_nodes, 
6333                                           [disk_dict], 
6334                                           file_path, 
6335                                           file_driver, 
6336                                           disk_idx_base)[0] 
6337          instance.disks.append(new_disk) 
6338          info = _GetInstanceInfoText(instance) 
6339   
6340          logging.info("Creating volume %s for instance %s", 
6341                       new_disk.iv_name, instance.name) 
6342          # Note: this needs to be kept in sync with _CreateDisks 
6343          #HARDCODE 
6344          for node in instance.all_nodes: 
6345            f_create = node == instance.primary_node 
6346            try: 
6347              _CreateBlockDev(self, node, instance, new_disk, 
6348                              f_create, info, f_create) 
6349            except errors.OpExecError, err: 
6350              self.LogWarning("Failed to create volume %s (%s) on" 
6351                              " node %s: %s", 
6352                              new_disk.iv_name, new_disk, node, err) 
6353          result.append(("disk/%d" % disk_idx_base, "add:size=%s,mode=%s" % 
6354                         (new_disk.size, new_disk.mode))) 
6355        else: 
6356          # change a given disk 
6357          instance.disks[disk_op].mode = disk_dict['mode'] 
6358          result.append(("disk.mode/%d" % disk_op, disk_dict['mode'])) 
6359      # NIC changes 
6360      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
6361        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
6362          # remove the last nic 
6363          del instance.nics[-1] 
6364          result.append(("nic.%d" % len(instance.nics), "remove")) 
6365        elif nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
6366          # mac and bridge should be set, by now 
6367          mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
6368          bridge = nic_dict['bridge'] 
6369          new_nic = objects.NIC(mac=mac, ip=nic_dict.get('ip', None), 
6370                                bridge=bridge) 
6371          instance.nics.append(new_nic) 
6372          result.append(("nic.%d" % (len(instance.nics) - 1), 
6373                         "add:mac=%s,ip=%s,bridge=%s" % 
6374                         (new_nic.mac, new_nic.ip, new_nic.bridge))) 
6375        else: 
6376          # change a given nic 
6377          for key in 'mac', 'ip', 'bridge': 
6378            if key in nic_dict: 
6379              setattr(instance.nics[nic_op], key, nic_dict[key]) 
6380              result.append(("nic.%s/%d" % (key, nic_op), nic_dict[key])) 
6381   
6382      # hvparams changes 
6383      if self.op.hvparams: 
6384        instance.hvparams = self.hv_inst 
6385        for key, val in self.op.hvparams.iteritems(): 
6386          result.append(("hv/%s" % key, val)) 
6387   
6388      # beparams changes 
6389      if self.op.beparams: 
6390        instance.beparams = self.be_inst 
6391        for key, val in self.op.beparams.iteritems(): 
6392          result.append(("be/%s" % key, val)) 
6393   
6394      self.cfg.Update(instance) 
6395   
6396      return result 

6397

6421 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6422      """Compute the list of all the exported system images. 
6423   
6424      @rtype: dict 
6425      @return: a dictionary with the structure node->(export-list) 
6426          where export-list is a list of the instances exported on 
6427          that node. 
6428   
6429      """ 
6430      rpcresult = self.rpc.call_export_list(self.nodes) 
6431      result = {} 
6432      for node in rpcresult: 
6433        if rpcresult[node].failed: 
6434          result[node] = False 
6435        else: 
6436          result[node] = rpcresult[node].data 
6437   
6438      return result

6441 -class LUExportInstance(LogicalUnit): 

6442    """Export an instance to an image in the cluster. 
6443   
6444    """ 
6445    HPATH = "instance-export" 
6446    HTYPE = constants.HTYPE_INSTANCE 
6447    _OP_REQP = ["instance_name", "target_node", "shutdown"]

6450 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

6451      self._ExpandAndLockInstance() 
6452      # FIXME: lock only instance primary and destination node 
6453      # 
6454      # Sad but true, for now we have do lock all nodes, as we don't know where 
6455      # the previous export might be, and and in this LU we search for it and 
6456      # remove it from its current node. In the future we could fix this by: 
6457      #  - making a tasklet to search (share-lock all), then create the new one, 
6458      #    then one to remove, after 
6459      #  - removing the removal operation altogether 
6460      self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET

6462 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

6463      """Last minute lock declaration."""

6466 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

6467      """Build hooks env. 
6468   
6469      This will run on the master, primary node and target node. 
6470   
6471      """ 
6472      env = { 
6473        "EXPORT_NODE": self.op.target_node, 
6474        "EXPORT_DO_SHUTDOWN": self.op.shutdown, 
6475        } 
6476      env.update(_BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, self.instance)) 
6477      nl = [self.cfg.GetMasterNode(), self.instance.primary_node, 
6478            self.op.target_node] 
6479      return env, nl, nl

6481 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

6482      """Check prerequisites. 
6483   
6484      This checks that the instance and node names are valid. 
6485   
6486      """ 
6487      instance_name = self.op.instance_name 
6488      self.instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(instance_name) 
6489      assert self.instance is not None, \ 
6490            "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
6491      _CheckNodeOnline(self, self.instance.primary_node) 
6492   
6493      self.dst_node = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo( 
6494        self.cfg.ExpandNodeName(self.op.target_node)) 
6495   
6496      if self.dst_node is None: 
6497        # This is wrong node name, not a non-locked node 
6498        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Wrong node name %s" % self.op.target_node) 
6499      _CheckNodeOnline(self, self.dst_node.name) 
6500      _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, self.dst_node.name)

6503      for disk in self.instance.disks: 
6504        if disk.dev_type == constants.LD_FILE: 
6505          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Export not supported for instances with" 
6506                                     " file-based disks")

6508 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6509      """Export an instance to an image in the cluster. 
6510   
6511      """ 
6512      instance = self.instance 
6513      dst_node = self.dst_node 
6514      src_node = instance.primary_node 
6515      if self.op.shutdown: 
6516        # shutdown the instance, but not the disks 
6517        result = self.rpc.call_instance_shutdown(src_node, instance) 
6518        msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
6519        if msg: 
6520          raise errors.OpExecError("Could not shutdown instance %s on" 
6521                                   " node %s: %s" % 
6522                                   (instance.name, src_node, msg)) 
6523   
6524      vgname = self.cfg.GetVGName() 
6525   
6526      snap_disks = [] 
6527   
6528      # set the disks ID correctly since call_instance_start needs the 
6529      # correct drbd minor to create the symlinks 
6530      for disk in instance.disks: 
6531        self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, src_node) 
6532   
6533      # per-disk results 
6534      dresults = [] 
6535      try: 
6536        for idx, disk in enumerate(instance.disks): 
6537          # new_dev_name will be a snapshot of an lvm leaf of the one we passed 
6538          new_dev_name = self.rpc.call_blockdev_snapshot(src_node, disk) 
6539          if new_dev_name.failed or not new_dev_name.data: 
6540            self.LogWarning("Could not snapshot disk/%d on node %s", 
6541                            idx, src_node) 
6542            snap_disks.append(False) 
6543          else: 
6544            new_dev = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=disk.size, 
6545                                   logical_id=(vgname, new_dev_name.data), 
6546                                   physical_id=(vgname, new_dev_name.data), 
6547                                   iv_name=disk.iv_name) 
6548            snap_disks.append(new_dev) 
6549   
6550      finally: 
6551        if self.op.shutdown and instance.admin_up: 
6552          result = self.rpc.call_instance_start(src_node, instance, None, None) 
6553          msg = result.RemoteFailMsg() 
6554          if msg: 
6555            _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
6556            raise errors.OpExecError("Could not start instance: %s" % msg) 
6557   
6558      # TODO: check for size 
6559   
6560      cluster_name = self.cfg.GetClusterName() 
6561      for idx, dev in enumerate(snap_disks): 
6562        if dev: 
6563          result = self.rpc.call_snapshot_export(src_node, dev, dst_node.name, 
6564                                                 instance, cluster_name, idx) 
6565          if result.failed or not result.data: 
6566            self.LogWarning("Could not export disk/%d from node %s to" 
6567                            " node %s", idx, src_node, dst_node.name) 
6568            dresults.append(False) 
6569          else: 
6570            dresults.append(True) 
6571          msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(src_node, dev).RemoteFailMsg() 
6572          if msg: 
6573            self.LogWarning("Could not remove snapshot for disk/%d from node" 
6574                            " %s: %s", idx, src_node, msg) 
6575        else: 
6576          dresults.append(False) 
6577   
6578      result = self.rpc.call_finalize_export(dst_node.name, instance, snap_disks) 
6579      fin_resu = True 
6580      if result.failed or not result.data: 
6581        self.LogWarning("Could not finalize export for instance %s on node %s", 
6582                        instance.name, dst_node.name) 
6583        fin_resu = False 
6584   
6585      nodelist = self.cfg.GetNodeList() 
6586      nodelist.remove(dst_node.name) 
6587   
6588      # on one-node clusters nodelist will be empty after the removal 
6589      # if we proceed the backup would be removed because OpQueryExports 
6590      # substitutes an empty list with the full cluster node list. 
6591      if nodelist: 
6592        exportlist = self.rpc.call_export_list(nodelist) 
6593        for node in exportlist: 
6594          if exportlist[node].failed: 
6595            continue 
6596          if instance.name in exportlist[node].data: 
6597            if not self.rpc.call_export_remove(node, instance.name): 
6598              self.LogWarning("Could not remove older export for instance %s" 
6599                              " on node %s", instance.name, node) 
6600      return fin_resu, dresults 

6601   

6602   
6603 -class LURemoveExport(NoHooksLU):

6607    _OP_REQP = ["instance_name"] 
6608    REQ_BGL = False

6610 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

6611      self.needed_locks = {} 
6612      # We need all nodes to be locked in order for RemoveExport to work, but we 
6613      # don't need to lock the instance itself, as nothing will happen to it (and 
6614      # we can remove exports also for a removed instance) 
6615      self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET 

6616   

6617 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

6618      """Check prerequisites. 
6619      """ 
6620      pass 

6621   

6622 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6623      """Remove any export. 
6624   
6625      """ 
6626      instance_name = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.instance_name) 
6627      # If the instance was not found we'll try with the name that was passed in. 
6628      # This will only work if it was an FQDN, though. 
6629      fqdn_warn = False 
6630      if not instance_name: 
6631        fqdn_warn = True 
6632        instance_name = self.op.instance_name 
6633   
6634      exportlist = self.rpc.call_export_list(self.acquired_locks[ 
6635        locking.LEVEL_NODE]) 
6636      found = False 
6637      for node in exportlist: 
6638        if exportlist[node].failed: 
6639          self.LogWarning("Failed to query node %s, continuing" % node) 
6640          continue 
6641        if instance_name in exportlist[node].data: 
6642          found = True 
6643          result = self.rpc.call_export_remove(node, instance_name) 
6644          if result.failed or not result.data: 
6645            logging.error("Could not remove export for instance %s" 
6646                          " on node %s", instance_name, node) 
6647   
6648      if fqdn_warn and not found: 
6649        feedback_fn("Export not found. If trying to remove an export belonging" 
6650                    " to a deleted instance please use its Fully Qualified" 
6651                    " Domain Name.")

6722      """

6724        self.re = re.compile(self.op.pattern)

6729 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6730      """Returns the tag list. 
6731   
6732      """ 
6733      cfg = self.cfg 
6734      tgts = [("/cluster", cfg.GetClusterInfo())] 
6735      ilist = cfg.GetAllInstancesInfo().values() 
6736      tgts.extend([("/instances/%s" % i.name, i) for i in ilist]) 
6737      nlist = cfg.GetAllNodesInfo().values() 
6738      tgts.extend([("/nodes/%s" % n.name, n) for n in nlist]) 
6739      results = [] 
6740      for path, target in tgts: 
6741        for tag in target.GetTags(): 
6742          if self.re.search(tag): 
6743            results.append((path, tag)) 
6744      return results

6855          raise errors.OpExecError("Error during master delay test")

6865   

6866   
6867 -class IAllocator(object): 

6868    """IAllocator framework. 
6869   
6870    An IAllocator instance has three sets of attributes: 
6871      - cfg that is needed to query the cluster 
6872      - input data (all members of the _KEYS class attribute are required) 
6873      - four buffer attributes (in|out_data|text), that represent the 
6874        input (to the external script) in text and data structure format, 
6875        and the output from it, again in two formats 
6876      - the result variables from the script (success, info, nodes) for 
6877        easy usage 
6878   
6879    """ 
6880    _ALLO_KEYS = [ 
6881      "mem_size", "disks", "disk_template", 
6882      "os", "tags", "nics", "vcpus", "hypervisor", 
6883      ] 
6884    _RELO_KEYS = [ 
6885      "relocate_from", 
6886      ] 
6887   

6888 -  def __init__(self, lu, mode, name, **kwargs): 

6889      self.lu = lu 
6890      # init buffer variables 
6891      self.in_text = self.out_text = self.in_data = self.out_data = None 
6892      # init all input fields so that pylint is happy 
6893      self.mode = mode 
6894      self.name = name 
6895      self.mem_size = self.disks = self.disk_template = None 
6896      self.os = self.tags = self.nics = self.vcpus = None 
6897      self.hypervisor = None 
6898      self.relocate_from = None 
6899      # computed fields 
6900      self.required_nodes = None 
6901      # init result fields 
6902      self.success = self.info = self.nodes = None 
6903      if self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
6904        keyset = self._ALLO_KEYS 
6905      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
6906        keyset = self._RELO_KEYS 
6907      else: 
6908        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown mode '%s' passed to the" 
6909                                     " IAllocator" % self.mode) 
6910      for key in kwargs: 
6911        if key not in keyset: 
6912          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Invalid input parameter '%s' to" 
6913                                       " IAllocator" % key) 
6914        setattr(self, key, kwargs[key]) 
6915      for key in keyset: 
6916        if key not in kwargs: 
6917          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Missing input parameter '%s' to" 
6918                                       " IAllocator" % key) 
6919      self._BuildInputData() 

6920   

6921 -  def _ComputeClusterData(self): 

6922      """Compute the generic allocator input data. 
6923   
6924      This is the data that is independent of the actual operation. 
6925   
6926      """ 
6927      cfg = self.lu.cfg 
6928      cluster_info = cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
6929      # cluster data 
6930      data = { 
6931        "version": constants.IALLOCATOR_VERSION, 
6932        "cluster_name": cfg.GetClusterName(), 
6933        "cluster_tags": list(cluster_info.GetTags()), 
6934        "enabled_hypervisors": list(cluster_info.enabled_hypervisors), 
6935        # we don't have job IDs 
6936        } 
6937      iinfo = cfg.GetAllInstancesInfo().values() 
6938      i_list = [(inst, cluster_info.FillBE(inst)) for inst in iinfo] 
6939   
6940      # node data 
6941      node_results = {} 
6942      node_list = cfg.GetNodeList() 
6943   
6944      if self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
6945        hypervisor_name = self.hypervisor 
6946      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
6947        hypervisor_name = cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.name).hypervisor 
6948   
6949      node_data = self.lu.rpc.call_node_info(node_list, cfg.GetVGName(), 
6950                                             hypervisor_name) 
6951      node_iinfo = self.lu.rpc.call_all_instances_info(node_list, 
6952                         cluster_info.enabled_hypervisors) 
6953      for nname, nresult in node_data.items(): 
6954        # first fill in static (config-based) values 
6955        ninfo = cfg.GetNodeInfo(nname) 
6956        pnr = { 
6957          "tags": list(ninfo.GetTags()), 
6958          "primary_ip": ninfo.primary_ip, 
6959          "secondary_ip": ninfo.secondary_ip, 
6960          "offline": ninfo.offline, 
6961          "drained": ninfo.drained, 
6962          "master_candidate": ninfo.master_candidate, 
6963          } 
6964   
6965        if not (ninfo.offline or ninfo.drained): 
6966          nresult.Raise() 
6967          if not isinstance(nresult.data, dict): 
6968            raise errors.OpExecError("Can't get data for node %s" % nname) 
6969          remote_info = nresult.data 
6970          for attr in ['memory_total', 'memory_free', 'memory_dom0', 
6971                       'vg_size', 'vg_free', 'cpu_total']: 
6972            if attr not in remote_info: 
6973              raise errors.OpExecError("Node '%s' didn't return attribute" 
6974                                       " '%s'" % (nname, attr)) 
6975            try: 
6976              remote_info[attr] = int(remote_info[attr]) 
6977            except (TypeError, ValueError), err: 
6978              raise errors.OpExecError("Node '%s' returned invalid value" 
6979                                       " for '%s': %s" % (nname, attr, err)) 
6980          # compute memory used by primary instances 
6981          i_p_mem = i_p_up_mem = 0 
6982          for iinfo, beinfo in i_list: 
6983            if iinfo.primary_node == nname: 
6984              i_p_mem += beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
6985              if iinfo.name not in node_iinfo[nname].data: 
6986                i_used_mem = 0 
6987              else: 
6988                i_used_mem = int(node_iinfo[nname].data[iinfo.name]['memory']) 
6989              i_mem_diff = beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] - i_used_mem 
6990              remote_info['memory_free'] -= max(0, i_mem_diff) 
6991   
6992              if iinfo.admin_up: 
6993                i_p_up_mem += beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
6994   
6995          # compute memory used by instances 
6996          pnr_dyn = { 
6997            "total_memory": remote_info['memory_total'], 
6998            "reserved_memory": remote_info['memory_dom0'], 
6999            "free_memory": remote_info['memory_free'], 
7000            "total_disk": remote_info['vg_size'], 
7001            "free_disk": remote_info['vg_free'], 
7002            "total_cpus": remote_info['cpu_total'], 
7003            "i_pri_memory": i_p_mem, 
7004            "i_pri_up_memory": i_p_up_mem, 
7005            } 
7006          pnr.update(pnr_dyn) 
7007   
7008        node_results[nname] = pnr 
7009      data["nodes"] = node_results 
7010   
7011      # instance data 
7012      instance_data = {} 
7013      for iinfo, beinfo in i_list: 
7014        nic_data = [{"mac": n.mac, "ip": n.ip, "bridge": n.bridge} 
7015                    for n in iinfo.nics] 
7016        pir = { 
7017          "tags": list(iinfo.GetTags()), 
7018          "admin_up": iinfo.admin_up, 
7019          "vcpus": beinfo[constants.BE_VCPUS], 
7020          "memory": beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
7021          "os": iinfo.os, 
7022          "nodes": [iinfo.primary_node] + list(iinfo.secondary_nodes), 
7023          "nics": nic_data, 
7024          "disks": [{"size": dsk.size, "mode": dsk.mode} for dsk in iinfo.disks], 
7025          "disk_template": iinfo.disk_template, 
7026          "hypervisor": iinfo.hypervisor, 
7027          } 
7028        pir["disk_space_total"] = _ComputeDiskSize(iinfo.disk_template, 
7029                                                   pir["disks"]) 
7030        instance_data[iinfo.name] = pir 
7031   
7032      data["instances"] = instance_data 
7033   
7034      self.in_data = data 

7035   

7036 -  def _AddNewInstance(self): 

7037      """Add new instance data to allocator structure. 
7038   
7039      This in combination with _AllocatorGetClusterData will create the 
7040      correct structure needed as input for the allocator. 
7041   
7042      The checks for the completeness of the opcode must have already been 
7043      done. 
7044   
7045      """ 
7046      data = self.in_data 
7047   
7048      disk_space = _ComputeDiskSize(self.disk_template, self.disks) 
7049   
7050      if self.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
7051        self.required_nodes = 2 
7052      else: 
7053        self.required_nodes = 1 
7054      request = { 
7055        "type": "allocate", 
7056        "name": self.name, 
7057        "disk_template": self.disk_template, 
7058        "tags": self.tags, 
7059        "os": self.os, 
7060        "vcpus": self.vcpus, 
7061        "memory": self.mem_size, 
7062        "disks": self.disks, 
7063        "disk_space_total": disk_space, 
7064        "nics": self.nics, 
7065        "required_nodes": self.required_nodes, 
7066        } 
7067      data["request"] = request 

7068   

7069 -  def _AddRelocateInstance(self): 

7070      """Add relocate instance data to allocator structure. 
7071   
7072      This in combination with _IAllocatorGetClusterData will create the 
7073      correct structure needed as input for the allocator. 
7074   
7075      The checks for the completeness of the opcode must have already been 
7076      done. 
7077   
7078      """ 
7079      instance = self.lu.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.name) 
7080      if instance is None: 
7081        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown instance '%s' passed to" 
7082                                     " IAllocator" % self.name) 
7083   
7084      if instance.disk_template not in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
7085        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't relocate non-mirrored instances") 
7086   
7087      if len(instance.secondary_nodes) != 1: 
7088        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has not exactly one secondary node") 
7089   
7090      self.required_nodes = 1 
7091      disk_sizes = [{'size': disk.size} for disk in instance.disks] 
7092      disk_space = _ComputeDiskSize(instance.disk_template, disk_sizes) 
7093   
7094      request = { 
7095        "type": "relocate", 
7096        "name": self.name, 
7097        "disk_space_total": disk_space, 
7098        "required_nodes": self.required_nodes, 
7099        "relocate_from": self.relocate_from, 
7100        } 
7101      self.in_data["request"] = request 

7102   

7103 -  def _BuildInputData(self): 

7104      """Build input data structures. 
7105   
7106      """ 
7107      self._ComputeClusterData() 
7108   
7109      if self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
7110        self._AddNewInstance() 
7111      else: 
7112        self._AddRelocateInstance() 
7113   
7114      self.in_text = serializer.Dump(self.in_data) 

7115   

7116 -  def Run(self, name, validate=True, call_fn=None): 

7117      """Run an instance allocator and return the results. 
7118   
7119      """ 
7120      if call_fn is None: 
7121        call_fn = self.lu.rpc.call_iallocator_runner 
7122   
7123      result = call_fn(self.lu.cfg.GetMasterNode(), name, self.in_text) 
7124      result.Raise() 
7125   
7126      if not isinstance(result.data, (list, tuple)) or len(result.data) != 4: 
7127        raise errors.OpExecError("Invalid result from master iallocator runner") 
7128   
7129      rcode, stdout, stderr, fail = result.data 
7130   
7131      if rcode == constants.IARUN_NOTFOUND: 
7132        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find allocator '%s'" % name) 
7133      elif rcode == constants.IARUN_FAILURE: 
7134        raise errors.OpExecError("Instance allocator call failed: %s," 
7135                                 " output: %s" % (fail, stdout+stderr)) 
7136      self.out_text = stdout 
7137      if validate: 
7138        self._ValidateResult() 

7139   

7140 -  def _ValidateResult(self): 

7141      """Process the allocator results. 
7142   
7143      This will process and if successful save the result in 
7144      self.out_data and the other parameters. 
7145   
7146      """ 
7147      try: 
7148        rdict = serializer.Load(self.out_text) 
7149      except Exception, err: 
7150        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: %s" % str(err)) 
7151   
7152      if not isinstance(rdict, dict): 
7153        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: not a dict") 
7154   
7155      for key in "success", "info", "nodes": 
7156        if key not in rdict: 
7157          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results:" 
7158                                   " missing key '%s'" % key) 
7159        setattr(self, key, rdict[key]) 
7160   
7161      if not isinstance(rdict["nodes"], list): 
7162        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: 'nodes' key" 
7163                                 " is not a list") 
7164      self.out_data = rdict 

7165

7167 -class LUTestAllocator(NoHooksLU): 

7168    """Run allocator tests. 
7169   
7170    This LU runs the allocator tests 
7171   
7172    """ 
7173    _OP_REQP = ["direction", "mode", "name"] 
7174   

7175 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

7176      """Check prerequisites. 
7177   
7178      This checks the opcode parameters depending on the director and mode test. 
7179   
7180      """ 
7181      if self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
7182        for attr in ["name", "mem_size", "disks", "disk_template", 
7183                     "os", "tags", "nics", "vcpus"]: 
7184          if not hasattr(self.op, attr): 
7185            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing attribute '%s' on opcode input" % 
7186                                       attr) 
7187        iname = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.name) 
7188        if iname is not None: 
7189          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' already in the cluster" % 
7190                                     iname) 
7191        if not isinstance(self.op.nics, list): 
7192          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid parameter 'nics'") 
7193        for row in self.op.nics: 
7194          if (not isinstance(row, dict) or 
7195              "mac" not in row or 
7196              "ip" not in row or 
7197              "bridge" not in row): 
7198            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid contents of the" 
7199                                       " 'nics' parameter") 
7200        if not isinstance(self.op.disks, list): 
7201          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid parameter 'disks'") 
7202        for row in self.op.disks: 
7203          if (not isinstance(row, dict) or 
7204              "size" not in row or 
7205              not isinstance(row["size"], int) or 
7206              "mode" not in row or 
7207              row["mode"] not in ['r', 'w']): 
7208            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid contents of the" 
7209                                       " 'disks' parameter") 
7210        if not hasattr(self.op, "hypervisor") or self.op.hypervisor is None: 
7211          self.op.hypervisor = self.cfg.GetHypervisorType() 
7212      elif self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
7213        if not hasattr(self.op, "name"): 
7214          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing attribute 'name' on opcode input") 
7215        fname = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.name) 
7216        if fname is None: 
7217          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' not found for relocation" % 
7218                                     self.op.name) 
7219        self.op.name = fname 
7220        self.relocate_from = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(fname).secondary_nodes 
7221      else: 
7222        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid test allocator mode '%s'" % 
7223                                   self.op.mode) 
7224   
7225      if self.op.direction == constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_OUT: 
7226        if not hasattr(self.op, "allocator") or self.op.allocator is None: 
7227          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing allocator name") 
7228      elif self.op.direction != constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_IN: 
7229        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Wrong allocator test '%s'" % 
7230                                   self.op.direction) 

7231   

7232 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

7233      """Run the allocator test. 
7234   
7235      """ 
7236      if self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
7237        ial = IAllocator(self, 
7238                         mode=self.op.mode, 
7239                         name=self.op.name, 
7240                         mem_size=self.op.mem_size, 
7241                         disks=self.op.disks, 
7242                         disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
7243                         os=self.op.os, 
7244                         tags=self.op.tags, 
7245                         nics=self.op.nics, 
7246                         vcpus=self.op.vcpus, 
7247                         hypervisor=self.op.hypervisor, 
7248                         ) 
7249      else: 
7250        ial = IAllocator(self, 
7251                         mode=self.op.mode, 
7252                         name=self.op.name, 
7253                         relocate_from=list(self.relocate_from), 
7254                         ) 
7255   
7256      if self.op.direction == constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_IN: 
7257        result = ial.in_text 
7258      else: 
7259        ial.Run(self.op.allocator, validate=False) 
7260        result = ial.out_text 
7261      return result
